loans.name: Apol

texts.en:
Apol lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has seven children; four of them are still in school. 

Apol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bebelacion

texts.en:
Bebelacion is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Bebelacion is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell in the market.

Bebelacion has been raising livestock  for eight years and also earns additional income from a local eatery.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell in the market.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dolores is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Dolores has a general store business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Dolores has been in this business for six years. In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 37 лет, имеет  троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2002 году Назира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, на сегодня  ее хозяйство приносит примерно 12,000 сом в квартал с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и коз. Доходы Назира планирует вложить в оплату обучения сына.
texts.en: Nazira is 37 years old and has three children. In search of a financing source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2002 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazira's persistent work, today her business yields about 12,000 som quarterly from sales of milk and meat products. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy sheep and goats. Nazira plans to invest the earnings into paying for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nabirakan

texts.ru: Набиракан 60 лет, вдова, проживает с семьей сына. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2000 году Набиракан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Набиракан, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется четыре дойные коровы, десять овец, две кобылы, что позволяет получать примерно 15,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Набиракан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых овец. Доходы Набиракан планирует вложить дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nabirakan is 60 years old, a widow and lives with her son's family. In search of a financing source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2000 with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nabirakan's persistent work, today her business has four dairy cows, ten sheep and two horses, which allows her to earn about 15,000 som per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy purebred sheep. Nabirakan plans to invest the earnings into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both her children are in school.

Elvira is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

Elvira has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her cows.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima works hard to support her family. Fatima is married and sells coconut wine as a business in the Philippines.

Fatima requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell to customers. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Fatima would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and piglets. She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Abuol

texts.en:
Abuol lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 39 years old, married, and has six children; three of them are still in school. 

Abuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling firewood  in the Philippines.

Leah requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from hog raising.

In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Johna is married and has two children.

To make a living, Johna owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting cassava and selling it in the local community. Johna has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Johna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers. Johna joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and a portion of it will be saved for her future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan Jose es un joven de 26 años al que le habría gustado poder estudiar gastronomía, pero por diversos motivos familiares no pudo cumplir este sueño, tras esta etapa de su vida decidió salir adelante y así generar los ingresos que necesitase para mejorar constantemente su calidad de vida.

Juan Jose vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar que en el transcurso de estos últimos 3 años ha afrontado un cambio positivo en el aspecto del desarrollo económico debido al ingreso de nuevas tiendas comerciales, los mismos que han generado innumerables puestos de trabajo estables y bajo la normativa de las leyes vigentes. Juan Jose detectó una nueva idea de negocio envista que ahora los compradores y trabajadores necesitaban transportarse a este gran centro comercial, es por esto que decidió dedicarse a brindar este tipo de servicio.

Debido a que aún no cuenta con el capital suficiente no ha podido tramitar su brevete y es por eso que ha recurrido a los prestatarios Kiva para que puedan apoyarlo en esta etapa de su vida y empiece a salir adelante independientemente. Con la generación de sus nuevos ingresos al trabajar formalmente desea poder tener una moto taxi propia y esforzarse más y más para comprarse un automóvil, su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Juan Jose is a young man of 26,  who would have liked to study cooking, but for various reasons was not able to fulfill that dream. After this stage of his life, he decided to move forward and generate the income he needed to constantly improve his quality of life. 

Juan Jose lives in the city of Ica, a place that over the course of the last three years has faced positive change with respect to economic development, due to the influx of new department stores. These have generated countless steady jobs that are regularized under existing laws. 

Juan Jose identified a new business idea, in view of the fact that shoppers and workers needed transportation to this new shopping center. That is why he decided to work at providing this type of service. 

Due to the fact that he still doesn't have sufficient working capital, he has not been able to afford the processing of his driver's permit. That is why he has resorted to the Kiva lenders to help him in this stage of his life, so that he can begin to make progress independently. 

Generating new income by working on a formal basis, he wishes to get his own mototaxi, and work harder and harder to buy a car, which is his great dream.

loans.use: To pay for the processing of his driver's permit.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 30 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 14. All her children go to school. She sells beans and sorghum. She has been selling these products for the past four years.
 
She wants the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. With the profits, she plans to renovate the house and buy a cow, which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están en España trabajando y los restantes aun son menores que son el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, procurando poder darles lo mejor y que tengan una vida son privaciones.
Ella tiene un copetín  bien surtido y muy conocida en el barrio. Una de sus hija mayor tiene 16 años y le ayuda en con las tareas del negocio, lo cual le es muy bueno.
Consiguió montar su copetín con un poco de dinero que le había juntado con el trabajo que realizaba anteriormente como asalaria y sumado a su esfuerzo hoy es lo que es. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, bebidas y demás productos para la venta en su negocio. Ella está contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
Señora Graciela is a single mother of four children, of whom two are working in Spain and two are still under age. Her children are her reason to struggle day by day and try to give them the best, so that they should have a life without privations.

She has a well-stocked fast-food counter, which is well known in her neighborhood. One of her eldest daughters is 16 and gives a hand in the business, which is very convenient for her. Graciela managed to start up her business with some money that she had saved when she was in salaried employment, and after some efforts she has become what she is now. She is a real go-getter and an honest person, known and loved by everyone in her neighborhood.

She applies for this loan to buy candy, drinks and other products for sale in her business. She is happy for the help received by the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks and other products for her fast-food counter.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha desea remodelar su equipo de trabajo ya que el actual esta en malas condiciones. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo más moderno que es un sillón más cómodo, un mueble con mejores adaptaciones de luz y espejo, y así darles un buen servicio y comodidad a sus clientes. Sus hijas le ayudan en el negocio de su salón de belleza que tiene, desea mejorar su equipo y ampliar su negocio y así tener más clientes. 
Doña Bertha ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual pago puntual mente y fue para comprar de productos para el negocio, espera contar con su cooperación en este préstamo que también será para mejorar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Señora Bertha wants to update her salon equipment, as what she has is now in a sorry condition. She is seeking a loan to buy more modern equipment: a more comfortable chair and a work station with adjustable light and mirror. With this she will give her customers good service and comfort. Her daughters help in the salon. She wants to improve her equipment, grow hher business, and have more customers. Bertha has already had one loan with Kiva, which she repaid on time. That loan was to buy products for the salon. She hopes she can count on your support for this loan, which once again will improve both her business and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yéssica tiene 21 años de edad, tiene un hijo de seis meses,  está acompañada con el Sr. Jorge en la ciudad de Paraguarí  hace aproximadamente dos años.
Yéssica es comerciante desde hace más de un año, tiene su propio negocio, que es una despensa, ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad, donde ya cuenta con clientela formada medio por el cual tiene un muy buen ingreso mensual lo que le ayuda a aportar con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma hacer un poco más ligera la carga a su marido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, carnes y demás productos de primera necesidad que son los que más salida tienen.
texts.en:
Yéssica, aged 21, is the mother of a six-month-old son and has been living with Señor Jorge in the city of Paraguarí for around two years.

She has been a merchant for over one year. She has her own business, which is a grocery located in a strategic area in the city with loyal customers who let her earn a very good monthly income, which enables her to contribute to household expenses and thus relieve her husband of some burden.

Yéssica applies for this loan to buy drinks, dairy products, canned food, meat and other products of daily use with the highest turnover.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, canned food, meat and other products of daily use.

loans.name: Elsa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es una mujer que a lo largo de estos 10 años ha trabajado como vendedora de desayunos y almuerzos, motivada solo por el hecho de progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Cuando Elsa culminó el colegio estaba deseosa de poder estudiar enfermería, pero debido a algunos problemas económicos en su familia ella no pudo estudiar esta carrera, pero con el tiempo aprendió que podría sentirse una mujer hecha siendo una microempresa.

Actualmente trabaja un promedio de 6 horas diarias, es en este tiempo donde puede atender un promedio de 26 clientes, tiempo en el que cocina y vende a sus clientes. Fue aconsejada por una amiga, gracias a ella inició la idea de laborar en este tipo de negocio.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Elsa desea poder comprar una nueva cocina para facilitar sus labores y a su vez comprar algunos accesorios necesarios para su negocio, con este apoyo y el esfuerzo que le va colocar a diario desea cocinar mucho más rápido, preparar mucha más comida y mejorar mucho más el aseo en su cocina. Elsa está convencida de que sus ingresos mejorarán y con estos podrá cumplir su gran sueño : “Tener un restaurant en el centro de la ciudad de Ica”, lugar en la que vive.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa has worked for over 10 years selling breakfasts and lunches. She is motivated simply by her drive to progress and to improve her standard of living. When Elsa finished school, she hoped to study nursing, but her family's financial constraints made this impossible. In time, however, she came to perceive herself as a woman who could run a small business.

Now she works an average of 6 hours a day, serving on average 26 customers. This includes the preparation toime she spends in the kitchen as well as the time she spends serving the customers. She was advised by a friend, and it is thanks to her that Elsa started out in this type of business.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Elsa hopes to be able to buy a new kitchen to facilitate her work, and at the same time to buy some of the kitchen equipment she needs for her business. With this support, and the work she puts in each day, she hopes to cook much more quickly, prepare more food, and have better food hygiene in her kitchen. Elsa is sure that her income will increase as a result, and with this she will one day accomplish her dream: to have a restaurant in the centre of the city of Ica, where she lives.

loans.use: To pay for a kitchen and kitchen accessories

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Cesáreo

texts.es:
El señor Cesáreo tiene el proyecto de colocar un portón al frente de su vivienda, para la seguridad de su familia, ya que tiene una hija pequeña de edad.
Don Cesáreo es empleado de una agencia aduanal como encargado, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. Desea poner el portón por la seguida de que su pequeña mejorar la calidad de vida y que su pequeña niña pueda salir a jugar sin problema  y con la protección necesaria para que no le pueda pasar algún accidente.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo, ya que su esposo se encarga del cuidado y atención de su hija.
texts.en:
Cesáreo has a project to install a gate in the front of his home. This for his family's security, as he has a small daughter.

Don Cesáreo works for a customs brokerage as a manager, and that is his source of income for supporting his family. He wishes to install a security gate to improve his quality of life, and so that his small daughter can go outside to play with no problem, and with the necessary protection so that no accident can happen to her.

He plans to pay off the loan with a part of the salary he receives from his job, since his wife is the one who looks after and cares for his daughter.

loans.use: To install a gate at the front of his house.

loans.name: Karanday Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Karanday es un grupo antiguo y muy responsable mantienen sus reuniones semanales, y a sus capacitaciones. Luchan semana tras semana por cumplir sus compromisos con  Fundación Paraguaya.
La señora Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, nos comenta que se dedica a la peluquería y que gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado crecer y de esa forma tener un mejor servicio que poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor comodidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, cremas, tijeras, peines, gel, y demás insumos que necesita para poder abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The women involved in the 'Karanday' committee are a well established group who have meetings every week, where they have trainings. They work week after week to be able to complete their compromises with 'Fundacion Paraguaya'. 

Marina is a very dedicated and hard worker. She told us that she makes a living form her beauty salon. She said that thanks to her efforts and sacrifice she has succeeded in growing her business. As a result she is able to offer her clients better service and more comfort. 

She is requesting a loan to buy shampoo, creams, scissors, combs, gel and other supplies that are necessary to be able to restock her salon. This will allow her to continue working and offering good service to her clients. She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to by supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Gulnisa

texts.ru: Гулнисе 52 года, замужем, воспитывает двух сыновей, младшему из которых 10 лет. Гулниса начала свою трудовую деятельность учителем биологии, и за высокие показатели в работе Гулниса отмечена наградой «Отличник образования КР». Сейчас Гулниса работает в школе села Покровка и в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 2000 году начала свой бизнес в животноводстве.  Благодаря упорному труду Гулнисы, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется одна корова с теленком и десять овец. Также Гулниса обрабатывает орошаемую землю в 2,15 га, где выращивает фасоль. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулниса обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров и минеральных удобрений. Доходы Гулниса планирует вложить дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Gulnisa is 52 years old, married and raising two sons, the youngest of whom is ten years old. Gulnisa started her work career as a biology teacher and was awarded the "Excellent Educator of the Kyrgyz Republic" medal for her high performance.  Currently, she works at a school in the Pokrovka village.  In search of a financing source for her family, Gulnisa started her own business in animal husbandry in 2000. Thanks to her persistent work, today her business has one cow with a calf and ten sheep. Also, Gulnisa works on 2.15 hectares of irrigated land, where she grows beans. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows and mineral fertilizers. Gulnisa plans to invest the earnings into increasing livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fertilizers

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: Раъно жительница Гиссарского района. Она замужем. Ей 46 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети работают, а муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама она окончила Педагогический Университет. По профессии она работает 20 лет. Также Раъно в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Ra'no is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 46 years old, married and has four children.  Her children work, and husband is working abroad.  Ra'no graduated from the Pedagogical Institute.  She has been working in her field for 20 years.  Also, Ra'no is involved in animal husbandry during her free time.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian, a 31-year-old married mother of two children, has been earning a living farming bananas in the Philippines for three years now. She earns additional income from food vending. Working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand the business, Vivian is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to harvest her bananas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to harvest her bananas.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is 33 years old and has two children. She is married and has both children are in school.

Lyn is in the agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines. Lyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

She has been raising hogs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Lyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 40 years old and has six children. Rosie is married and two of her are in school.

Rosie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rosie would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Santalat

texts.ru:
Санталат 47 лет, замужем, воспитывает троих детей.  В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Санталат начала свой бизнес, арендовав место на центральном рынке. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду  Санталат, начав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), она сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  15,000 сом (KGS). Хороший ассортимент товара Санталат, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе одежды привлекают  все большее количество клиентов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санталат обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение весеннего  ассортимента товара.  Доходы от кредита Санталат планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Santalat is 47 years old, married and raising three children.  In search of an income source for her family, she started her own business in 2000 by leasing a space at the central market.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Santalat was able to develop her business, started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), to yield a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Good selection of merchandise, friendly service and practical advice with clothing selection attract more and more customers.  In order to further develop her business, Santalat requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her spring merchandise selection. She plans to invest the earnings into making repairs to her house.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es:
Jade es un grupo de vecinas que habitan en la misma cuadra y que se conocen desde hace 10 años aproximadamente. Sus reuniones están ubicadas en el municipio de Monterrey, N.L.

La Sra. María es una de las integrantes del grupo Jade, es una mujer muy trabajadora de 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, un niño de 5 años al cual cursa 3° año de kínder y una jovencita de 18 años quien se dedica a trabajar en una tienda de ropa. María es comerciante en mercados rodantes desde hace 5 años y nos cuenta que su negocio comenzó cuando su hermana un día le regalo mucha ropa y juguetes, pero como a ella le daba vergüenza su hija fue la que empezó a vender y conforme fue pasando el tiempo se fue acostumbrando y con ayuda del crédito se elevaron sus ventas y comenzó a vender también productos de belleza, joyería, elotes y frituras. María desea seguir surtiendo mercancía y poder comprar un carrito para vender elotes, no solo fuera de sus casa, si no también en otras colonias y en un futuro con las ganancias que obtenga  poder mejorar su hogar y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
'Jade' is a group of organized neighbors who all live in the same block and that have all known each other for approximately 10 years. Their meetings are located in the municipality of Monterrey, N.L. 

Maria is one of the members of the 'Jade' group. She is a very hard working woman and is 44 years old. She has two children, a 5 year old boy who is in kindergarten and a teenage girl who is 18 years old and works in a small clothing store. Maria has been a merchant in mobile markets for the past 5 years. She told us that her business began when her sister gave her a large amount of clothing and toys. But because it gave her shame to go out and sell, her daughter was the one who started selling. After some time she got comfortable with the idea and with the help of a loan she increased her sales and started to sell beauty products, jewelry, corn on the cob and 'frituras' (a fried snack food) as well. Maria wants to restock her merchandise and to buy a small cart to be able to sell corn on the cob from, so that she isn't limited to only selling outside of her home, but can also go to different neighborhoods. In the future, with her profits, she wants to improve her house and buy a car.

loans.use: to restock merchandise and buy a small cart to sell corn on the cob from.

loans.name: Nueva Union Group

texts.es:
La Union es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Pilar, ellas son todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se han unido con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto, ya que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de la fundación paraguaya. El objetivo de cada una de ellas es poder ayudar a sus familiares e hijos.
Noemi es una de las integrantes del comité, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace un buen tiempo. Ha logrado hacerse de muy buena fama con sus clientes y ha podido formarse una clientela bien determinada. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora que se halla en busca de un crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, ya que tiene pedidos, y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos, además quiere surtirse para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
'La Unión' is a group of eleven women from the city of Pilar.  They are all friends and neighbors from this city who came together with the aim of helping each other through their joint work.  They saw Fundación Paraguaya's program as a great opportunity to make progress.  Every member's aim is to be able to help their family members and children.

Noemi is one of the group's members.  She has been selling clothing for a long time.  She has managed to become very well known amongst her customers and has established a good customer base.  She describes herself as a very hard-working person who is seeking both financial and personal growth.

Noemi is requesting a loan to buy clothing as she has orders and she would like to fill them.  She would also like to stock her business so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Dieu D'abraham De Meyak 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Lucien est la coordonateur de son groupe Dieu d’abraham de meyak. Il habite dans la ville de Meyak d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il n’est pas marié. il a 2 enfants

Lucien a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il  etait a l’ecole. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du produits alimentaires. 

Lucien espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres Dieu d’abraham ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Lucien dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussines. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Lucien is the coordinator of the Dieu d'Abraham group, in Meyak. He lives in the town of Meyak, Haiti, where electricity is scarce and the water supply is strictly limited. He is not married, and has two children. 

Lucien has been running his business for the last 6 years. Before that, he was in school. He would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of food products. Lucien hopes that this loan will help him expand his business. The other group members need the loan for business activities such as selling coal, rice, and used clothing.

According to Lucien, his greatest challenge is the lack of a steady flow of customers. His main goal is to expand his business. He dreams of buying a truck to transport  merchandise.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 52 years old and two of her children are in school.

Cecilia has a variety store business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like noodles, sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 15 years. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Emilse

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos, viven en casa de su propiedad ubicada en un caserío rural donde los pobladores se dedican exclusivamente a la ganadería y la agricultura, el cual pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande en la Región Piura.

María se dedica desde hace muchos años atrás a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de ganado ovino y aves de corral para lo cual recorre todos los caseríos aledaños ofreciéndolos. Su esposo apoya en las actividades diarias y a la vez ayuda a generar otros ingresos dedicándose a sus propias chacras y trabajando en diferentes fundos de los caseríos aledaños.

Actualmente María se ha propuesto invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para su rápido crecimiento y mayor engorde de su ganado por lo que solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 Nuevos Soles para poder comprarlo y así pueda ganar mayores utilidades con las que puede hacer frente a sus responsabilidades de su hogar.
Los vecinos la consideran y estiman mucho por ser una mujer trabajadora y luchadora por salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: María is 34 years old.  She lives with her husband and five children in her own house, located in a rural village where the inhabitants work exclusively in cattle-raising and farming.  The village is called Charan Coposo CP-7 54, and belongs to the district of Tambogrande, in the province of Piura.  For many years, María has been raising, fattening, and marketing sheep and poultry and traveling throughout the surrounding villages to sell them.  Her husband helps her daily with these activities and in turn, he helps generate other income by working on his own farm as well as other farms in the surrounding villages.  At the present time, María is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.   She plans to use the funds to purchase balanced feed so that her cattle will grow faster and gain more weight.  This will enable her to earn higher profits and meet her household responsibilities.  The neighbors regard her as a hard-working woman struggling to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta es una mujer muy entusiasta, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 2 de ellos ya son mayores edad y los otros dos aún dependen de sus cuidado una de 8 años y la mayor de 10, ambos acuden al colegio y en algunas semanas retomarán nuevamente el ciclo escolar.

Benedicta y su esposo se esfuerzan mucho para sacar a sus hijas, mientras él se dedica a la preparación y reparto de menús, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y helados en su pequeña bodega, la misma que fue recuperada gracias a uno de sus hijos mayores debido a que hace algunos meses su padre tuvo un accidente, esposo de la señora Benedicta, y por esas razones no pudo ayudar en la generación de ingresos y poco a poco tenían sólo el dinero necesario para el día a día y ya no para invertir, es por eso que su hijo decidió ayudarlos y sacar un préstamo para que ella abriese la tienda, con la única condición de que se esforzara mucho, Benedicta con la buena noticia se lleno de alegría y aperturó nuevamente su negocio, gracias a Dios actualmente su esposo está mucho mejor y ha retomado sus labores.

Benedicta tiene la ilusión de abrir un Mini Market, actualmente trabaja un promedio de 15 horas diarias, tiene su negocio en la parte frontal de sala para así poder cuidar también de sus pequeñas. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá mejorar sus ingresos, pero actualmente no tiene el dinero necesario para realizar la compra útiles escolares y otros artículos debido a que en algunas semanas ya se iniciaran las clases y sus clientes han empezado a solicitarle ese tipo de productos, es por eso que ha recurrido a la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva.

Ella está decidida que en algunas semanas realizará la implementación también de su sala para que forme parte de la bodega que tiene, desea retribuirle de esa manera a su hijo el apoyo que le dio cuando ella más lo necesitaba y es gracias a ello que está obteniendo mejores ingresos y con ello brindará una mejor educación a sus dos pequeñas hijitas.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a very enthusiastic person. She is married and has 4 children, two of which are adults and the other two, whom she is still caring for are 8 years old and 10 years old. They are both in school and in a few weeks will resume with classes again. 

Benedicta and her husband work hard to help their children get ahead. Her husband earns income preparing and distributing meals and she sells groceries and ice creams from her small store. Her store was recently reopened, thanks to one of her older children. A few months ago her husband had an accident and was not able to work to provide income. They got to the point where they only had money for day to day necessities and nothing to reinvest in the store. It is because of this that their son decided to help them by taking out a loan so that Benedicta could stock her store and re-open her business, with the only condition that she must work hard. With this good news Benedicta was filled with joy and she re-opened her store. Thanks to God her husband has now recovered and has returned to work.    

Benedicta has the dream of opening a Mini Market. She is currently working an average of 15 hours a day. She has her business in the front part of her living room so that she can take care of her small children at the same time. With much effort and dedication she will be able to improve her income, but right now she doesn't have the necessary money to buy the school supplies and other items that she will need when classes start in a few weeks, and which her customers have already started asking for. It is for this reason that she has requested a loan through Kiva.   

She has decided, in a few weeks, to start using a part of her living room as storage for the store. She wants to repay her son for the support he provided her when she needed it most. She is thankful that she is increasing her income, with which she will provide a better education to her two small daughters.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and other items for the beginning of the school year.

loans.name: Giovana Carlotta

texts.es:
Giovana tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, Nazca es una ciudad peruana ubicada en la región centro-sur del Perú, es una ciudad muy activa, debido a la afluencia de turistas que visitan a diario las milenarias Líneas de Nazca, y también por el desarrollo en auge minero, agrícola y comercial de la zona, que la están convirtiendo en unas de las ciudades más cosmopolitas del sur peruano, es madre de un pequeño de 3 años al cual adora mucho y es lo más importante que dios le ha podido regalar porque es un ángel para ella, en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho escuchar música ya que la ayuda a relajarse, uno de sus platos favoritos son los riquísimos “Tallarines Rojos”.

Giovana trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, al cual le dedica alrededor de 12 horas diarias, asimismo puede llegar a atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y le gusta atender de manera cordial a sus clientes, es por ello que siempre regresan a comprar los productos que ella ofrece.

Giovana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio(arroz, azúcar, entre otros), así podrá tener más variedad de productos y así tener más ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando día a día para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Giovana is 28, and lives in the city of Nazca. Nazca is a Peruvian city located in the south central region of Peru. It is a very lively city, due to the influx of tourists who visit every day to see the ancient Nazca Lines, and also because of the area's booming development in mining, agriculture, and commerce. It is becoming one of the most cosmopolitan cities in southern Peru. 

She is the mother of a small 3-year-old, whom she really adores, and is the most important gift that God could give her, because to her, he is an angel. In her free time, she really likes to listen to music, as it helps her to relax. One of her favorite dishes is the very delicious "Tallarines Rojos" (similar to spaghetti).  

Giovana works in her grocery store, to which she devotes around 12 hours a day. This way she can manage to serve up to 20 customers a day. She believes her business is going well because she is very responsible and likes to serve her customers in a friendly way. This is why they always come back to buy the products she sells. 

Giovana is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their support she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, such as rice, sugar and other products. This way she will be able to have more product variety, and have more income, which will allow her to continue striving day by day to fulfill her greatest dream: "To have her own house."

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es:
Jean Carlos tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente, la casa donde vive esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en la Región Piura. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura y ganadería.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica Jean Carlos es el alquiler de vestuario de danzas en toda la zona de Tambogrande, en su casa ha acondicionado un espacio para poder exhibir sus prendas.  Los vestuarios que alquila son confeccionados por él mismo y son trajes que representan a la cultura de su región. Entre los trajes que alquila tiene como por ejemplo: faldas de marinera, blusas, gorros, sombreros serones, chuyos, mantos entre otros, los cuales alquila de acuerdo a la época o a solicitud de instituciones educativas.

Actualmente solicita un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para la compra de telas con las que confeccionará más trajes que por ahora no tiene y sus clientes buscan. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres para quienes se ha propuesto trabajar responsablemente con el fin de mejorarles su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos is 21 years old. He is single and has no children. At this time he lives in the house of his parents, whom he supports economically. The house where they live is located in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura, where the principal economic activities are agriculture and livestock-raising.

Jean Carlos' business is renting clothing for dances everywhere in the zone of Tambogrande. He has set up a space in his house to exhibit his costumes, which he makes himself and which represent the culture of the inhabitants of this region. Among the costumes that he rents, he has, for example, skirts for the marinera dance, blouses, caps, sombreros, knitted caps, and cloaks, among other items, which he rents according to the season or the educational institution.

He is now applying to Edpyme Alternative for a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN to buy fabric with which he will make more costumes that he doesn't have now and that his customers are looking for. He has the backing of his parents, for whom he has proposed to work responsibly with the goal of improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make costumes

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 42 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos, cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive junto a su esposo e hijos toda la familia cuanta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, la casa en la que viven esta ubicada en en el distrito de La Matanza en la Región Piura.

Lucila se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de venta por catálogo en su propio domicilio, para lo cual ya tiene una experiencia de 3 años, ella recorre todos los caserío aledaños al suyo para ofrecer sus productos, contando ya con su clientela quienes mantienen una muy buena relación comercial. Ella inició su negocio con muy poco capital de trabajo ahora en la actualidad se ha generado ya su clientela y ha hecho crecer un poco más su inversión.

El objetivo de Lucila es incrementar su negocio con el que pueda generarse mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia, pues cuenta con todo el apoyo de parte de su esposo y sus hijos, ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1008 Nuevos Soles los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de una vitrina la cual le servirá para exhibir mucho mejor sus productos.

Lucila es muy conocida en la zona por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora, pues por el tipo de negocio que cuenta Lucila tiene muy buenas referencias.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 42, is married and has two children.  She has her own house where she lives with her husband and children.  The whole family has good personal and work references.  Their house is in the La Matanza district, which belongs to the Morropón province in the Piura province.

Lucila sells beauty products from the Esika and Avon lines.  She sells from her own home, and she has three years of experience.  She travels to all of the surrounding settlements in order to offer her products.  She maintains a very good business relationship with her customers.  She started her business with very little work capital.  Now she has generated her clientele and has made her investment grow a little more.

Lucila’s objective is to increase her business so that she is able to generate more income.  That way she will be able to improve her quality of life and her family’s quality of life.  She has total support from her husband and her children.

She is now requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,008 soles.  She will buy a display case so that she can better display her products.  

Lucila is well known in the area for being a responsible and hard-working person.  For the type of business that she has Lucila has very good references.

loans.use: to buy a display case to better show her products.

loans.name: Lucy Magaly

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 36 años de edad es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Olmos, el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque.

Lucy se dedica al comercio de plásticos (tinas, baldes entre otros) para lo cual cuenta con un puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado principal de Olmos.  Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, los cuales le han servido para hacerse muy conocida y buscada por sus clientes quienes están fidelizados por la buena atención que les brinda. Su esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte por lo que ayuda a la canasta familiar recibiendo ingresos diarios.


Lucy se ha planteado muy bien sus objetivos de cada día crecer más en su negocio y convertirse en mayorista de toda la zona donde vive, para lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de variedad de plásticos con los que podrá satisfacer los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes, de esa manera generarse mayores ingresos y poder asumir su responsabilidad con nuestra institución y a la vez mejorar su calidad de vida.


Lucy se ha hecho muy conocida por el tipo de negocio que tiene y por mantener una buena relación con los vecinos de su zona, pues la consideran una mujer muy luchadora por el bien de su familia
texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children.  They own their own home, which is located in the district of Olmos, province of   Lambayeque.  

Lucy is in the business of selling plastic items (pitchers, pails, and other items).  She has a sales stand in Olmos’ main market.   She has dedicated herself to this business for about six years and has become well-known and sought after by her loyal customers because of the good service that she provides.  Her husband provides transportation services, and the daily income he earns helps pay for the family’s basic necessities.

Lucy has considered her goals carefully. She plans to grow her business on a daily basis and become a wholesaler for the entire region in which she lives.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a variety of plastic products so that she will be able to fill pending customer orders. This will enable her to generate more income, assume her responsibility with our institution, and at the same time, improve her quality of life.

She is very well-known for the type of business that she has and for maintaining good relations with the neighbors in her area, who regard her as a woman who strives for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase plastic products.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una madre de familia muy responsable que tiene 49 años de edad, vive sola junto a su esposo ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente.  La casa en la que viven es de su propiedad y esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, el mismo que pertenece a la Región Piura. El AAHH donde reside por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

La actividad a la que Isabel se dedica es a la venta de comida, cerveza y chicha de jora, pues ha acondicionado espacios estratégicos en su sala y jardines con el fin de que pueda brindar una buena atención a sus clientes que normalmente es gente trabajadora de campo y a sus vecinos, pues los días que mas clientela tiene son los sábados y domingos.  El compromiso de salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida es de ambos cónyugues por lo que su esposo trabaja en el campo como jornalero obteniendo sus ingresos de manera semanal.

Isabel en su afán de seguir creciendo desea invertir en la compra de mobiliario para su negocio, para lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en comprar mesas y sillas con los que podrá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Se ha hecho muy conocida por lo que su negocio es muy concurrido por sus vecinos quienes dan muy buenas referencias de ella.
texts.en:
Isabel is a very responsible 49 year old wife and mother. She lives alone with her husband since her children are already grown and financially independent. They own the house they live in, which is located in AAHH Túpac Amaru Mz F Lte 5 in the district of Tambogrande, in the Piura. Where they live only has the basic service of electricity.

The activity that Isabel does is selling food, beer and chicha de jora. She has set up strategic space in her living room and in her garden in order to offer good service to her customers, normally hardworking people from the country and her neighbors. The days she has the most customers are Saturdays and Sundays. Both spouses have the commitment to get ahead and improve their quality of life. Her husband works in the country as a laborer receiving his wages every week. 

Isabel, with her wish to continue growing, wants to invest in buying furniture for her business. That is why she is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 2000 Nuevos Soles. She will invest them in buying tables and chairs with which she can give her customers better service.  

She has become very well known and her business is much visited by her neighbors, who give her good references.

loans.use: to buy furniture (chairs and tables) for her business.

loans.name: Jannyna

texts.es:
Jannyna tiene 30 años de edad es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente se encuentra viviendo en casa de sus padres, de quienes recibe todo el apoyo posible en cuanto a sus actividades, la casa en la que vive se encuentra ubicada en un cacerío perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande en la Región Piura. Caserío que por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

La actividad que desarrolla Jannyna es la crianza de ganado porcino, crianza de cuyes y aves de corral, para lo que ha acondicionado espacios en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los cuales una vez que alcanzan el peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en mercado local o también en mercados de otros caseríos. Además se desempeña como profesora de lunes a viernes en una Institución Educativa cercana a su caserío, percibiendo ingresos mensuales.

Jannyna desea seguir creciendo y día a día mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus padres por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles, los cuales destinará para la compra de alimentos balanceados con los que podrá alimentar y darles un mas rápido crecimiento a sus animales y ofrecerlos a mejores precios. 
Es muy conocida por la labor de educadora que realiza, pues se ganado el respeto y admiración de todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Jannyna is 30 years old, is single and has no children.  She is currently living in her parents' home; they give her their complete support for her business.  The house she lives in is located a village known as "Tejedores Bajo Mz  X Lote 52ª,” which belongs to Tambogrande District in Piura Province.  The only basic service her village has is electricity.

Jannyna's business is raising pigs, guinea pigs and poultry.  She has equipped a space in the back of her house for the business.  Once her livestock reach an ideal size and weight, she sells them in the local market or in other village markets.  Jannyna also works as a teacher Monday through Friday at the "Institución Educativa" (Educational Institution) near her village.  She receives a monthly salary from her work as a teacher.

Jannyna wants to continue growing her business and to, day by day, improve her quality of life and that of her parents.  And so she is requesting a sum of 2000 Nuevos Soles (USD $750) from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase animal feed.  With the loan, she will be able to feed her livestock so they will grow more quickly, which will allow her to sell them at a better price. 
Jannyna is well known for her work as a teacher and has earned the respect and admiration of all her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de ella, viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en la Región Piura. A pesar de ser una pequeña comunidad rural ya cuentan son los servicios básicos como el agua y la energía eléctrica.

María se dedica a la venta de comida en instalaciones de su propio domicilio; para lo que se levanta a tempranas horas de todos los días de la semana y prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas para las personas que trabajan en campo. A la fecha ya se ha generado su propia clientela quienes la solicitan por la buena atención que les brinda.  Su esposo ayuda a generar otros ingresos para el sustento de su familia trabajando para una empresa exportadora de donde recibe ingresos quincenales.

María desea tener una mejor calidad de vida por lo que se propuesto solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 500 Nuevos Soles para la compra de materiales de construcción con los cuales podrá arreglar el techo de su casa, debido a que la constantes y fuertes lluvias han deteriorado y causan filtraciones.

Ella es muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable de las condiciones de vida de su familia, pues se ha ganado la consideración y cariño de todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, married and has two children that are dependent on her. They live in their own home located in which is part of the Tambogrande district in the province of Piura. Despite the fact that it is a small rural community it does have basic services like water and electricity. 

María makes a living selling food from her home. As a result, she wakes up early every day of the week to prepare breakfasts, lunches and dinners for the people who work in the fields. She has built a customer base that go to her because of the attention she gives them. Her husband helps with other income to sustain the family. He works in an export company where he makes a bi-weekly income. 

María wants to have a better quality of life which is why she is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will purchase construction materials to fix her roof because the constant, heavy rains have deteriorated it and produced leaks. 

She is very well known for being a hardworking woman and responsible with regard to her family's condition. She has won the considerations and affection of all of her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, se dedica a la venta de carne, desde muy pequeña ella vendía con sus mamá y al crecer sus mamá le dio un capital para que ella pueda trabajar y desde la fecha ella hizo que su capital crezca, con Finca Perú aprendió a ser ahorrativa y tener así dinero extra para los gastos de su casa, también para la educación de sus hija, ahora ya tiene una nieta y esta muy feliz, su hija también es socia, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de reces.
texts.en: Felicitas is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity)Communal Bank. She engages in selling meat. When she was a child she used to help her mother selling meat; then her mother gave her some money to start her own activity once she was older, and since the day she started she has succeeded in making her working capital grow. Thanks to Finca Peru she has learned how to be frugal and to consequently save some extra money to pay for the household expense as well as for the education of her daughter. She now has a granddaughter and she is very happy, and also her daughter is a member of Finca Peru. She will invest the loan in the purchase of beef.

loans.use: To buy beef for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Awel

texts.en:
Awel lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Awel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es: Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 43 años, se dedica a la venta de quesos y bordados y también tiene una carpintería, es madre de 5 hijos, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace muchos años, y trabajan su esposo y sus hijos, ella esta muy feliz por todo lo que recibe en Finca, ya que las capacitaciones y el préstamo, le ayudan para que sus negocios puedan progresar, su carpintería ha progresado mucho, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de madera.
texts.en: Aurea is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) Communal Bank. She is 43 years old, she sells cheese and embroidered items and she also runs a carpenter’s shop. She has 5 children, and she has been engaged in carpentry, and her husband and children work with them. She is very happy with everything she has received form Finca, as both the seminars and the loans are a great help for the growth of her activities. Her carpenter’s shop has had an important growth and she will use the loan she has requested to buy wood.

loans.use: To buy wood for her carpenter’s shop.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 44 años, se dedica a la venta de zapatos, es madre de 4 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 2 años. En este corto tiempo ha podido ver que sus ganancias están  subiendo, le encanta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque le ayudan a mejorar como madre y como negociante, le enseñan a administrar el dinero, está muy contenta con sus ahorros porque están creciendo, lo que desea es poder tener un terreno y esta trabajando para eso, y ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos.
texts.en: Agripina is a member of the Generosidad (Generosity) Communal Bank. She is 44 years old, she has 4 children, she sells shoes and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years. In this short time she has seen that her earning have constantly improved. She loves the seminars she attends in her Communal Bank because they help her improving as a mother and as a retailer. She has learnt how to administer her money and she is very satisfied with her savings because they are increasing. She wants to own some land and she is working to make this dream com true. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her activity.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Cresenciana works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed and green algae or 'guso' business in the Philippines.  In addition, she earns added income from selling fish.  Cresenciana is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy both materials for her seaweed business and fingerlings (young or small fish).

In the past, Cresenciana has sustained her business activities through a series of 19 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, saving money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy both materials for her seaweed business and fingerlings (young or small fish).

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married with three children.  With all her children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase products to sell in her store.  Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Genecita

texts.en:
Genecita is 40 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family, running a mobile business which sells used clothing in the Philippines.  She has been running her business for 6 years, and also earns an income from a general store.

Genecita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of use clothes to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 8 previous loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves es socia del FINCA Perú, se dedica a la venta de gelatina, cancha, en los 17 años que esta en Finca pudo aprender lo necesario para poder guiar a sus hijos y su negocio, es una socia muy puntual y responsable, siempre esta dispuesta a poder colaborar con la Junta Directiva, ella esta muy contenta con la ayuda que le brindan, ella con Finca pudo realizar sus metas, y la educación de sus hijos, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gelatina y cancha.
texts.en: Nieves is a member of Finca Peru, and she sells gelatin and popcorn. She has benne a member of Finca Peru for 17 years and during this time she has learned what she needed to educated her children and to run her activity. She is a very responsible and punctual member of Finca, always ready to cooperate with the board of directors. She is very happy with the help she receives, as thanks to Finca she has been able to achieve her goals and to educate her children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy gelatin and popcorn.

loans.use: To buy gelatin and popcorn.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Alicia has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  Alicia has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old.  She is married and has three children, one of whom attends school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emelia has a sari-sari store, or general store, business in the Philippines.  Emelia has requested a loan in the amount of 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy groceries to stock and sell in her store.  She has been in this business for four years.

Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock and sell in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 31 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has had this business for 2 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 3 previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is 59 years old and widowed with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has had this business for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Leliosa has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 3 previous loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a una de las miembros, quien motivo a sus amigas y vecinas a formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, ellas encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité, al que llamaron Mujeres unidas. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 22 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad.
Zulma es un ejemplo de lucha, ya que ella por medio de su esfuerzo y su trabajo ayuda a su familia. Con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropas puede ayudarlos y de esa forma aligerar un poco los gastos del día a día. Su sueño es poder tener algún día, una gran tienda de ropas, donde ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales desea poder surtir su negocio. Está muy agradecida por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues será muy provechoso para ella.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of its members who motivated her friends and neighbors to become part of a group of entrepreneurial women in the Paraguayan Foundation.  They were delighted and accepted being part of the committee which they call “Mujeres unidas” (United Women).  There are now 22 members and each one has a small business.

Zulma is an example of a fighter because she now helps her family with her effort and the work that she does.  With her small clothing sales business she can help them each day by lightening the household expenses a little.  Her dream is to some day have a big clothing store where she can offer a large variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Carmenia

texts.en:
Carmenia is 60 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Carmenia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store, or general store, in the Philippines.  She has been in business for three years and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to stock and sell.  

Carmenia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF prior to this loan.  In addition, she earns an income from fattening pigs, selling food as well as buying and selling bananas.

Carmenia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is 53 years old and married with 7 children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as sardines, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc. 

Morena has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.  In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has had this business for 2 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Roselie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her store. She has borrowed and repaid 4 previous loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул  49 лет, вдова, воспитывает сына – школьника. Как и многие семьи в  поисках доходов для семьи,   Айнагул откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2009 году со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,   Айнагул содержит одну корову и две овцы в своем хозяйстве, продажа молочных и мясных продуктов позволяет зарабатывать для семьи около 8,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса,   Айнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы.    Доходы   Айнагул планирует вложить в проведение ремонта в квартире.
texts.en: Ainagul is a 49-year-old widow who is raising a son, still in school.  Like many families in search of income for their family, Ainagul fattens livestock.  She started this activity in 2009 with an initial amount of 20,000 som (KGS).  Today, she owns one cow and a couple of sheep, and the sale of dairy and meat products allows her to earn close to 8,000 som per month for her family.  In order to further expand her business, Ainagul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow.  With her revenues, she plans to do some repairs in her apartment.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is aged 28 and has been in farming for six years. She is married with two children, aged 6 and 3 years, with the first-born already schooling. Her farm produces maize and beans which she sells to the local market.

Lilian has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kulimo to buy poultry. She hopes to be able to  raise enough income to cater for her family's basic needs. She aspires to become the main supplier for poultry products, both broilers and layers, in the region.

She laments poor prices and rampant animal diseases, especially poultry diseases. She is urging Juhudi Kilimo to introduce school fee loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya and has been in mixed farming for 17 years. He is aged 37 and married with four children  with the last two still schooling. He sells his farm produce of maize, milk and horticultural products within the local market. He gets additional income from his bicycle repair.

Abdallah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds .He says the new venture will help him spread his farming risk and offer better nutrition for his family. He is optimistic and says he will have a stable source of income to be able to take good care of his family.

Abdallah laments the high cost of feed and other inputs, coupled with  lack of enough capital.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a farmer in Kitale and a mother of three children of school-going age. She has been in farming for 10 years with her produce of maize and vegetables going to the local market. She runs a cereal shop in the local market for additional income.

Everlyne has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and  insure a dairy cow. She says the income will help her in paying for her children’s education. She  hopes to be able to raise more capital from her savings and venture into poultry farming as well in future.

She however laments animal diseases and poor market prices for farming products.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy  cow.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia tiene 27 años y es soltera con un  hijito que tiene la edad de tres meses, la señora tiene su tienda de barrio hace cinco años ella es cuidadora de la casa donde vive y a la vez tiene la tienda de barrio que es de su propiedad,  este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución,  Cinthia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de refrescos y  dulces para surtir su tienda,  estos productos  tiene mucha demanda en la tienda por encontrarse cerca de una cancha donde se realizan partidos los días sábados y domingo,  Cinthia se enfrenta retos en su negocio que son de tener una mejor tienda en comparación de la competencia,  utilizara los beneficios para la compra de mas productos para su tienda, la Sra. Cinthia es una persona muy  trabajadora con ganas  de superación y desea con el tiempo también vender comida y así tener muchos mas ingresos.
texts.en: Cinthia is 27 years old, single, and has a three-month-old son.  For five years now she has owned and operated a neighborhood grocery store.  She is also the caretaker of the house where she lives.  This is Cinthia’s first loan with Emprender, and she is going to use the loan to purchase soft drinks and sweets so she can restock her store.  There is high demand for these products at her store, since it is located close to a field where games are held on Saturdays and Sundays.  The main challenge that Cinthia faces with her business is to have a better store than the competition.  She plans to use her profits to purchase more products for her store.  Cinthia is a very hardworking woman with a desire to improve.  She eventually wants to sell meals as well so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and sweets for her neighborhood grocery store.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 69 years old and widowed with 5 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

Lucrecia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nyantiba

texts.en:
Nyantiba lives in bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 34 year old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Nyantiba heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James, aged 23 years old, has one child who is three years old. He owns a boutique which he has been running for 3 years. He has requested the loan to buy more salt, sugar and maize flour for sale. With the profits from the business, James plans to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. Mercedes is married and has a  business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.

Mercedes requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Mercedes has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Guldana

texts.ru: Гулдане 41 год, замужем, воспитывает двух детей, старший из которых учится в первом классе.   Гулдана – бухгалтер по образованию, что помогло ей в 2008 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, начать свой бизнес в торговле. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Гулдана сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 2,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Гулдана  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  весеннего ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Гулдана  планирует вложить в покупку павильона на рынке, что позволит ей создать комфортные условия для клиентов и соответственно повысить продажи.
texts.en: Guldana is 41 years old, married, and has two children, the oldest of whom goes to the firsts grade. Guldana is an accountant by trade. In 2008, while searching for help to increase her family's income, she started her own business in trade.   Due to hard work and diligence, Guldana was able to develop her business so that it provides 2,000 KGS every month. Right now, she does not carry a wide assortment of goods. Therefore, she approached Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase her inventory. With income from the loan, Guldana plans to buy a shop in the market that will be comfortable for her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry  está situado  en  la Ciudad de Carapeguá, en total son 14 mujeres trabajadoras,   el deseo de cada una de ellas es progresar, tienen muchas perspectivas, ideas y metas para invertir el crédito. El comité está conformado por mujeres que están emprendiendo una actividad y con el objetivo de invertir sus créditos para lograr más ganancias.
Hipólita es una mujer muy trabajadora, comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy entrada la noche. Tiene una despensa, en donde surte a sus vecinos con todo tipo de productos. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, y que gracias a su trabajo ha ido creciendo.
