En esta ocasión invertirá los recursos de este préstamo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, azúcar, arroz y refrescos para su pulpería, y también invertirá en telas, hilos y en cremalleras para su sastrería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paula lives in the community of Venecia in the city of Choluteca in southern Honduras, which is one of the warmest parts of the country.  She lives with her two daughters and her husband who is a taxi driver and supports her in her commitments.

She is a very hard worker and very dedicated to her businesses, which she has been in for 24 years.  Every day she makes a great effort to grow in her activities and have a better quality of life.  On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy corn, beans, meat, sugar, rice and soft drinks for her grocery store, as well as buy fabric and thread for her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat and sugar for her grocery store, and thread and fabric for her sewing business.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
San Pedro es el grupo que se conformó en la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 13 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Se unieron al programa de la fundación paraguaya, ya que vieron en el, un gran apoyo par a todos sus emprendimientos. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Podemos hablar de la señora Liz que con sus 5 hijos vive en una casita humilde, y es ella por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio, quien los mantiene. Ella se dedica a la venta de ensalada de fruta y de chipa lo fines de semana.
Liz  se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que desde siempre ha luchado, y no tiene miedo a los desafíos. Lucha diariamente por darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas, como ser manzanas, bananas, naranjas, melones, ciruelas y demás tipos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y manteniendo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
San Pedro is a group in the city of Asunción that is comprised of 13 women who are all friends and neighbors in the city.  They joined the Fundación Paraguaya's program because they saw it as a great way to obtain support for their businesses.  They are currently in their first loan cycle and their goal is to reach the top level of the program.

We can talk about Mrs. Liz who lives with her five children in a humble dwelling, and through her hard work and sacrifice, provides for her family.  She sells fruit salad on weekends.  Liz defines herself as a hard-working, enterprising person who has always struggled to get ahead, meeting challenges head on.  She works hard every day to give the best she can to her children so they do not have to go without like she did. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy fruit such as apples, bananas, oranges, melons, plums and other types of fruit.  This is so she can continue working to support her children.

loans.use: To buy fruit to make fruit salad.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El  señor Jose Luis, se ha dedicado desde hace mas de 10 años, a la venta de artículos eléctricos como también realiza reparaciones  como ser, cambio de cableado, bombillos, toma corrientes  entre otros, como no tiene un local el  sale todas las mañanas a diferentes barrios y caseríos de su comunidad a ofrecer sus servicios, como su trabajo es muy bueno algunos clientes lo recomiendan a otro, gracias a estos ingresos el logra sostener a su hijos.
Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 8,000.00, para la compra de materiales eléctricos, espera que Prisma pueda apoyarle.
texts.en:
Jose Luis has been making a living selling electrical items for more than 10 years. He also does repairs like changing the cabling, lightbulbs, and outlets, among others. Since he doesn't have a shop he goes out every morning to different neighborhoods and very small villages in his community to offer his services. Because his work is very good some customers recommend him to others. Thanks to this income he has been able to support his children.

He is requesting a loan worth L. 8,000.00 to buy electrical materials. He hopes Prisma can support him.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 24 years old. She has two children aged one and four; both go to school. With the loan she wants to buy more foodstuff to sell. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver. She wants to use the profits for to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan was born in 1950 in Khashtarak Village, Tavush Region. Ruslan is married and now his family consists of his wife, his son, daughter-in-law, and his two year-old grandchild.  Nobody in Ruslan’s family works except for him. Ruslan works at Ijevan Road Building Company as a welder. Ruslan also has run his own business for almost 40 years: he fulfils private orders for welding. He has his own truck and necessary equipment for welding. Ruslan offers his service to the entire Tavush region’s territory, and so he has many orders. With the income from his business Ruslan keeps his family well. Recently his welding equipment was damaged, and as this is only source of income for Ruslan’s family, he is asking for a $ 3,000 loan to repair it to continue to fulfill orders on a high level.

loans.use: To repair welding equipment.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina tiene 48 años de edad es madre 1 hijo y vive junto a su esposo en una casa que es de propiedad, su casa esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre de “La Colorada” el cual esta a unos 15 minutos del Distrito de Morrope y el mismo un aproximado de 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

 Clementina se dedica la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales como ovinos, vacunos, y aves de corral para lo que ha instalado espacios en la parte posterior de su casa, negocio el cual ya viene desarrollando varios años atrás y el cual ha sido el sustento para su familia, pues ya sus clientes la conocen por ser una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos comerciales así que se comunican con ella cada vez que la necesitan. Su esposo apoya a generar ingresos semanales trabajando como jornalero en los diferentes fundos de su caserío.

Y es que ambos están comprometidos en mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que Clementina esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles, los cuales los utilizará para la compra de  Ganado ovino y a la vez materiales con los que pueda mejorar sus corrales.
texts.en:
Clementina, aged 48, is the mother of one son and lives with her husband in their own house in La Colorado, a rural hamlet about 15 minutes from the district of Morrope, which itself is located about one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Clementina breads, fattens and sells animals, such as sheep, cattle and poultry. She uses the backyard of their house for her business, which she has developed over several years and which has been the livelihood of the family. Her customers know her as a person with a high sense of responsibility in her business dealings and always turn to her whenever they need her products. Clementina's husband supplements their weekly income as a laborer working in the various farms of the village.

The couple is committed to improving their living conditions. Therefore Clementina came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1000 new soles to buy sheep and building material to improve her pens.

loans.use: to buy sheep and building material.

loans.name: Oñoñeeme Group

texts.es:
Oñoñeeme es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunción por 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras, quienes decidieron formar parte del programa de la fundación paraguaya en miras a un futuro mejor para sus familias. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 3er. ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una de las que integrantes,  además de la responsabilidad en los pagos.
Mariciana es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta  y elaboración de bijouterie desde hace un tiempo. Cuenta que hace todo tipo de joyas, aros, anillos y demás. Gracias a la gran creatividad que tiene siempre tiene lindo productos que ofrece a sus clientes y los cuales tienen buena aceptación.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perlas, hilos, ganchos, pinzas, lentejuelas y demás insumos que necesita para poder hacer los bijouterie que vende.  Está agradecida con la fundación y kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Oñoñeeme is a group in the city of Asunción which is comprised of 16 hard-working women who decided to join the Fundación Paraguaya's program in an aim to improve their families' futures.  The communal bank is currently in its third loan cycle and is known for its sense of responsibility and participation in activities and meetings.  Each one of the members has desires to get ahead and is responsible in paying back the loan.

Mariciana is a member of the group and she makes and sells costume jewelry.  She has been in business for quite some time.  She makes all kinds of jewelry, earrings, rings, etc.  Because of her great creativity she always has beautiful products which are very popular among her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy beads, thread, hooks, clips, sequins and other supplies she needs to make the jewelry she sells.  She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
San Blas es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado por 12 miembros, quienes son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy emprendedoras y con mucho entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante. Quieren poder ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor porvenir sin privaciones.
Andrea es una de las miembros, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la costura. Es un oficio en el que trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que experiencia le sobra. Gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida, lo cual le genera muy buen ingreso. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y agrandar su taller.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder compra de telas e hilos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia con el día a día.
texts.en:
San Blas is a group formed in Asunción. It is made up of 12 members who are hardworking women and above all very entrepreneurial with a lot of enthusiasm and a desire to get ahead. They want to be able to help their families to have a better future without deprivations.

Andrea is one of the members. She tells us that she makes a living sewing. It's a trade in which she has worked for a long time and in which she has much experience. Thanks to the time that she has been working in this area she has been able to form a defined clientele which has generated a very good income. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and expanding her workshop.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy fabric and thread, with which she will be able to continue working and in this way continue helping her family from day to day.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en: Our business in life is not to get ahead of others, but to get ahead of ourselves (E. Joseph Cossman). Ms. Marialyn is a businesswoman. She is married, residing in Catagan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, and blessed with one school-aged child.  Ms. Marialyn is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative; she borrowed money from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for additional business capital. She earns PHP 5,000 monthly in her business as profit. Ms. Marialyn improves her living conditions with the use of the profits.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Narsiza

texts.es:
Narciza tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de nombre “El Horcon” el mismo que se encuentra en el distrito de Túcume, aproximadamente a 45 minutos al norte de la Provincia de Chiclayo. Sus habitantes normalmente se dedican al comercio y ganadería.

Narciza desea mejorarse sus condiciones de vida tanto para ella como para sus hijos por lo que ha emprendido en diferentes rubros comerciales, ella cuenta con sus maquinas de coser en las cuales brinda servicio de sastrería a todos sus vecinos, adicionalmente cría, y comercializa animales menores como aves de corral y también produce chicha de jora lo que le genera ingresos diarios, por los distintos rubros a los que desempeña con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposo se ha hecho muy conocida en todo el distrito de Túcume pues es muy considerada y respetada por su buen trato y por el cumplimiento de sus compromiso comerciales.

Narciza esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa con lo que invertirá en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde y rápido crecimiento de sus animales y pueda venderlos a mejores precios.
texts.en:
Narciza, 50, is married and has two children.  They live in their own house in a rural community called "El Horcon" which is in the district of Túcume, approximately 45 minutes north of the Chiclayo Province.  The population here is usually involved in commerce and livestock farming.

Narciza wants to improve living conditions for both herself and her children, and so has undertaken different commercial activities.  She has sewing machines and offers her services as a seamstress to her neighbors.  She raises and sells small animals such as poultry, and also makes "chicha de jora" (maize drink) which generates a daily income.  Because of all her business activities, in which she is helped by her children and husband, she has become well known in the district of Túcume.  She is well considered and respected for her kindness and reliability in her commercial commitments.

Narciza is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced animal feed to improve the fattening process and speed up development of her animals so she can sell them at better prices.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Kyre´y se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y su meta es poder trabajar y ayudar a sus familias en los gastos de día a día.
Una de las miembros es la señora Blanca, y nos comenta que tiene muy buena clientela debido a que siempre tiene muy buen abastecido su negocio. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, carbón, aceites y demás insumos. Ella, al igual que todo su grupo está contenta por la ayuda de la fundación.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Kyrey was formed by the union of various female neighbors from the city of Santaní. They are very hardworking women and their goal is to be able to work and help their families with expenses from day to day.

One of the members is Blanca. She tells us that she has a very good clientele due to the fact that she has always kept her business stocked very well. Her desire is to be able to continue growing and offer her customers greater comfort.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks, food, canned goods, charcoal, oils, and other supplies. She, along with her whole group, is happy with the foundation's help.

loans.use: to buy most-needed items to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Armando

texts.es:
El señor Jairo es una persona muy emprendedora  vive  en el barrio Libertad de la ciudad de Choluteca. Vive junto con a sus 2 hijos y su  esposa quien también  es comerciante y le ayuda en su negocio. Él es muy trabajador dedicado en toda su plenitud a su negocio de venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años. En esta oportunidad utilizará este préstamo para la compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, azúcar, arroz, refrescos y embutidos en general para vender en su negocio.

Él es muy honrado y responsable en cada uno de sus compromisos, cada día que pasa trabaja muy fuerte hacer crecer su negocio y así de esta manera tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Señor Jairo is a very enterprising man living in Libertad, a neighborhood in the city of Choluteca. He lives with his two children and his wife, who is also a merchant and helps him in his business. Jairo is a hard-working man and is fully dedicated to his general grocery store, which he has been running for three years. He will use this loan to buy corn, beans, meat, sugar, rice, drinks and sausages on the whole to sell in his store.

He is very honest and responsible in all his dealings. He works hard to expand his business with each passing day and thus have a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sausages and other goods for sale in his grocery store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora  Maria quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. De ahi surge el grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario, el cual está integrado por 19 mujeres muy trabjadoras y emprendedoras, con muchas ansias de luchar y salir adelante.
La Sra. Maria tiene un copetin donde vende alimentos, bebidas, golosinas y demás. Esta acompañada hace 18 años, tienen tres hijos dos menores de edad y una mayor de edad. Tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia como ser alimentacion, vivienda, educación. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que día a día lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, verduras, aderezos y demás insumos para seguir elaborando los alimentos que vende y tambien bebidas para poder surtir su local.
texts.en:
Señora Maria started off this committee by organizing and inviting her friends to become a part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Enterprising Women] program. It was from there that the group Virgen del Rosario came about. The 19 women who make up the group are very hardworking and enterprising and they are eager to fight to get ahead in life. 

Señora  Maria has a fast food counter where she sells food, drinks, candy and other items. She has a partner of 18 years and they have three children, two minors and one adult. Her goal is to continue expanding her business, thus providing her family with a better way of life i.e., food, a home and education. She describes herself as a very hardworking and enterprising person who fights day after day to give her family the best.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, baked goods, vegetables, seasoning and other ingredients to continue producing the food that she sells and also to stock her business premises with drinks.

loans.use: to buy drinks and ingredients to stock her fast food counter

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is a 62-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a seaweed farmer. Basilia has been growing and selling seaweed for 12 years. She earns about PHP 5000 per month from this business. Basilia also runs a small sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods, toiletries, and snacks.

Basilia has requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings and more items to sell at her store. Basilia hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 32 years-old. He has three children between the age of seven and 15 years, and all go to school. His wife is a business woman selling clothes. Emmanuel has spent seven years in the business. He sells shoes, and has requested the loan to add more shoes to his stock. With the profits, he hopes to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To add more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Grace Divine Group

texts.fr: GRACE DIVINE est un groupe constitué de deux personnes qui sont des amies et dont la représentante du nom de Falilatou Abebi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Falilatou Abebi est âgée 36 ans et a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Falilatou Abebi est mariée à un brodeur du nom de Daouda. Falilatou Abebi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Falilatou Abebi assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Falilatou Abebi, en vue de faire face aux charges familiales, vend des produits cosmétiques et de mèches depuis une dizaine d'année dans une ville du Benin. Falilatou Abebi s'approvisionne au Nigeria et parfois au Benin. Afin de réhausser leur niveau d'activité, Falilatou Abebi sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe GRACE DIVINE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: GRACE DIVINE is a group of two people who are friends .The representative is Falilatou Abebi who has her hand raised in the photo. Falilatou Abebi is 36 years old and stopped going to school at primary level. Falilatou Abebi is married to an embroiderer called Daouda. Falilatou Abebi lives with her husband and their children. The couple have three children all of whom go to school at their parents’ expense. Falilatou Abebi helps her husband with the family expenses. To help support the family she has been selling cosmetics and locks of hair for about ten years in a town in Benin. Falilatou Abebi buys her stock in Nigeria and sometimes in Benin. In order to enhance their activity, Falilatou Abebi, together with the second member of the GRACE DIVINE group, requests a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and locks of hair.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Don Alfredo, tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su compañera de hogar. Se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la compra y venta  de vehículos, constituido como comerciante individual con el nombre de “Transporte Hernández” con más de 12 años de experiencia de dedicarse a esta actividad que opera de manera ambulante y a domicilio.
El Sr. Alfredo no cuenta en estos momentos con el capital necesario para llevar a cabo el negocio ya que como a veces las ventas no las llevan al contado le está faltando liquidez para continuar con la compra de vehículos. El espera con este préstamo inyectarle la liquidez necesaria al negocio para que continúe creciendo y consolidándose.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo is 53 years-old and lives with his partner. He makes a living doing business and his principal activity is buying and selling vehicles. He is represented as an individual dealer with the name "Hernández Transport" and has more than 12 years of experience dedicated to this activity that he manages traveling and from home.

At this time Mr. Alfredo does not have the necessary capital to run his business since at times his sales are not in cash but credit. He is lacking the liquidity to continue buying vehicles. He hopes that this first loan will inject the necessary liquidity into his business so that he can continue growing and consolidating.

loans.use: to buy used cars to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Vicente

texts.es:
Carlos Vicente tiene 25  años es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

El señor Carlos Vicente se dedica al trabajo de venta de repuestos de motos, en un almacén arrendado
Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas en Comercial La Moto. El dinero lo va invertir en la comprar de respuestos como focos, pistones, rines, bujias, baterias, cadenas y juego de arrastre.

El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Carlos Vicente es tener un negocio más grande, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos y la competencia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Vicente is 25 years old, he is married and he lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Cantón Ventanas province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank El Sagrado Corazon [The Sacred Heart] is located in the Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre area, in Cantón Ventanas. This communal bank deals with trade.

Señor Carlos Vicente sells motorbike parts for a living in a rented store. He purchases the parts in La Moto in Ventas city. He is going to invest the money in the purchase of parts such as lights, keys, alloy rims, spark plugs, batteries, chains and a pulley.

The loan helped him to increase production and to have more quality products. Carlos Vicente’s dream is to have a bigger business. He has faced challenges such as high prices and competition.

In his free time he enjoys spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy  lights, keys, alloy rims, spark plugs, batteries, chains and a pulley.

loans.name: Iraida Germania

texts.es:
Iraida Germania tiene 33 años es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

La Señora Iralda se dedica al negocio de Yambal, es decir a la venta de cosméticos por medio de revistas y a dar asesoría de belleza. El credito lo va invertir en labiales, esmaltes, perfumes, cremas.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Guayaquil por medio de correo electrónico. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Iralda es tener dinero para comprar un carro para el negocio, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos y la competencia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear con los padres pos la ciudad.
texts.en:
Iraida Germania is 33 years-old, married, and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank El Sagrado Corazón is located in the sector of the streets Ernesto Briones and Parroquía 10 de Noviembre. It belongs to the canton of Ventanas and this communal bank makes a living doing business.

Iralda makes a living selling Yambal- selling cosmetics by means of magazines- and giving beauty advice. She is going to invest the loan in lipstick, nail polish, perfume, and cream.

She purchases the supplies in the city of Guayaquil by means of email. The loan will allow her to increase production and have quality products. Iralda's dream is to have money to buy a car for her business. She has encountered challenges like high prices and competition.

In her free time she likes to walk around the city with her parents.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, nail polish, perfume, and cream.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Josephine est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Josephine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Josephine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Josephine mène comme activité, la vente des produits divers, des boissons et des produits vivriers dans sa région au Benin. Josephine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire, Josephine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Josephine is 46 and married to a man called Louis. The couple have six children all of whom attend school at their parents’ expense. Josephine lives with her husband and children and shares the family expenses with her husband. Josephine did not go to school. For the last ten years Josephine has been selling various goods, beverages and food products in her region in Benin. Josephine buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover, Josephine requests a fourth loan from ALIDé. The three previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: to purchase various goods and food products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia   Ruth pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” y vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde también realiza sus actividades económicas. 

La socia Ruth se dedica a la venta de ropa como por ejemplo camisas, casacas, pantalones y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Ruth requiere el préstamo para compra más ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de ropa.  

La socia Ruth agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member Ruth belongs to the communal bank “Imasumac II” and lives in the city of Cusco where she also carries out her economic activities.  

The member Ruth earns a living selling clothing, for example, shirts, jackets, pants and some additional items. On this occasion Ruth needs the loan to purchase more clothing. She has been making a living selling clothing for a number of years now. 

The member Ruth appreciates the support being given her, and likewise she commits to making her payments in disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Wangnignigbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNIGNIGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mireille (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Mireille est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Célestin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mireille, Pour subvenir à ses besoins, vend depuis près de sept ans des friperies, des sous vêtements et des bijoux de façon secondaire dans son quartier au Benin. Mireille s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Mireille désire augmenter le stock de ses produits ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Mireille sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNIGBE.
texts.en: WANGNIGNIGBE is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighbourhood. The representant of the group, Mireille (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old.Mireille is married to a cook by the name of Celestin. The couple have two children, they pay school fees for both of them. To cover their needs, for nearly seven years Mireille has been selling second hand clothes, underwear and jewellery in her neighbourhood in Benin.Mireille buys her stock in a market in Benin. In order to enlarge her business and to be more competitive, Mireille would like to increase her stock; which will enable her to increase her turnover and her income. For this reason, Mireille requests a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the WANGNIGNIGBE group.

loans.use: Purchase second hand goods.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandrina

texts.es:
Mayra Alejandrina tiene 28  años es soltero, vive con los hijos. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.

Mayra Alejandrina  se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la casa vende productos de primera necesidad. El credito lo va invertir para la comprar de aceites, arroz, azucar, harinas, sal, fideos, detergentes y cosas de primera necesidad.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas donde el Señor Juan Arevalo. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Mayra Alejandrina es seguir en el negocio y tener mas ganancias para dar mejor nivel de vida a los hijos, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Mayra Alejandrina is 28 years old and lives with her children. She lives in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos.

The EL SAGRADO CORAZON communal bank is locate in the area of the streets Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre. It belongs to the  Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to sales.

Mayra Alejandrina is a merchant. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells basic necessity products. She is going to invest the loan in buying oils, rice, flours, salt, pasta, detergents and basic necessity items. 

She buys her merchandise in the city of Ventas from Mr. Juan Arevalo. The loan has helped her to increase production and have quality products. Mayra Alejandrina's dream is to continue in her business and make more profit to give her children a better quality of life. She has faced some challenges, such as prices. 

She likes to spend time with her children in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy oils, rice, sugar, flours, salt, pasta, detergent, and basic necessity items.

loans.name: Fernando José

texts.es:
Fernando José es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se dedica a la docencia desde hace muchos años el cual imparte clases a niños de primaria en una escuelita rural donde se siente muy satisfecho de enseñarles a leer y escribir a estos niños que son el futuro de nuestro país.

Es un señor muy dedicado a su hogar y junto con su esposa, la cual también es maestra luchan por preparar a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor nivel de vida en el futuro.

Como padres responsables y dedicados está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para pagar los gastos que incurren en elaboración de monografías para obtener el título como profesional, de dos de sus hijos los cuales ya culminaron su carrera pero necesitan su título como tal para iniciar a buscar trabajo y tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Confía en Dios  que Ceprodel le podrá brindar su mano para lograr su objetivo, ya que con sus pequeños salarios no pueden cubrir estos costos tan altos.
texts.en:
Fernando José is from the municipality of El Sauce and has been in the teaching profession for many years. He teaches elementary school children in a small rural school where he is very happy teaching reading and writing to these children who are the future of our country. 

He is a man who is very dedicated to his home and, along with his wife who is also a teacher, they strive to prepare their children for a better quality of life in the future. 

As responsible and devoted parents he is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to pay for costs associated with the writing of monographs required to obtain a professional degree, for two of his children who have already finished their studies but who need their finalized degree in order to begin looking for work and have a better quality of life. 

He trusts in God that Ceprodel will be able to lend him a hand to achieve his goal, since with their small salaries they are not able to cover such high costs as these.

loans.use: to pay the costs associated with writing monographs for his two children attending university.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Pedro; son de la zona de San Lorenzo, son reconocidas en la zona por su trabajo en pos del bienestar de la comunidad y de sus familias, ya que son muy unidas y siempre trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto las unas a las otras.
La señora Graciela como ejemplo trabaja en manualidades en conjunto con las integrantes del comité también se dedica a la venta de ropa en su barrio, todos la conocen por buena persona que es y que ayuda a su prójimo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir vendiendo y creciendo como comerciante. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The San Pedro committee is from the area of San Lorenzo. They are known in the area for the work they do for their community's and families' wellbeing. They are very close and always working in and environment of respect for each other. 

Graciela, for example, works with crafts together with one of the committee members. She also sells clothes in her neighborhood. Everyone knows her as a good person who helps others.
   
She is asking for the loan to buy clothing, in order to have stock. This way, she can keep selling and growing as a merchant. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to later sell.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
la señora Lorena es uno de los integrantes de un grupo llamado Las Violetas el cual esta integrado por nueve personas cada uno con una actividad economica diferente:

Eulalia cria y venta de ganado 
Carlos venta de refrescos 
Ausencia venta de abarrotes 
Regina venta de dulces 
Agustina venta de antojitos 
veronica venta de dulces 
Brenda venta de pollo 
Marcelina venta antojitos 
maria venta de abarrotes 
lorena venta de abarrotes 

Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad donde el clima es calido y esta rodeada de holeras(arboles de hule), es una zona cañera y las principales fuentes de trabajo son en el campo cosechando hule y en el corte de la caña en tiempo de zafra(cuando el ingenio esta produciendo azucar). Su gente es muy amable y trabajadora.


La señora Lorena tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio una carrera tecnica y esta casada con el señor adolfo que desempeña el oficio de carpintero, ellos tuvieron tres hijos pero actual mente solo depende de ella la mas pequeña de nombre Paola que tiene 9 años y estudia la primaria ya que las dos mayores ya estan casadas.

Doña lorena nos platica que hace un año su padre le heredo una tienda de abarrotes la cual tiene 60 años de antiguedad ya que pertenecio a su abuelo despues a su padre y en la actualidad a ella es un negocio familiar,
Ella dice que cuando se lo heredaron ella vio en el una fuente de empleo con la cual ayudaria a su esposo a sacar adelante a su hija pequeña asi que ela continua abrindolo todos los dias de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche y atendiendo a sus clientes muy cordialmente.
Ella ha pedido este credito para invertirlo en la compra de leche,huevos, detergentes, refrescos, dulces, aceite, frijol, papel higienico,servilletas, galletas, sopa, cafe y azucar  para resurtir su negocio.

ella piensa que si su negocio esta bien surtido habra mas clientes que acudan a su negocio ha hacer sus comprar lo cual traera mas ingresos y su negocio y calidad de vida mejorara.

A doña lorena le gustaria que en un futuro su hija tuviera la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.

Este grupo agradece el apoyo y confiansa que la fundacion les ha brindado
texts.en:
Lorena is one of the members of a group called “The Violets” that is comprised of nine people, each having a different type of business:

Eulalia raises and sells livestock
Carlos sells beverages
Ausencia sells groceries
Regina sells candies
Agustina sells snacks
Veronica sells candies
Brenda sells chicken
Marcelina sells snacks
Maria sells groceries
Lorena sells groceries

This group finds itself located in a community where the climate is warm that is surrounded by groves (rubber trees).  It is a sugarcane zone, and the principal fountains of work are in the field harvesting rubber and the cutting of cane during the harvest season (when the refinery is producing sugar).  Its people are friendly and hard working.

Lorena is 45 years old, studied a technical career and is married to Adolfo, who is a carpenter.  They had three children but currently only the youngest, Paola who is 9 years old and in primary school, still depends on her.  Her two older daughters are married.

Lorena tells us that, one year ago, she inherited a 60-year old grocery store from her father.  It belonged to her grandfather, then her father, and is currently her family business.

She says that when she inherited the business, she saw it as the source of employment with which she could help her husband to get their young daughter ahead.  To this end, she continues to open her store every day from eight in the morning until eight at night, tending to her customers very cordially.

She has requested this loan to invest in the purchase of milk, eggs, detergents, refreshments, candies, oil, beans, toilet paper, napkins, cookies, soup, coffee and sugar to resupply her business.

She believes that, if her business is well stocked, she will have more customers frequent her establishment for their purchases.  This, in turn, will bring her more income and her business and standard of living will improve.

In the future, Lorena would like to see her daughter have the opportunity to study a professional career.

This group is thankful for the support and confidence that the Foundation has afforded them.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, detergents, refreshments, candies, oil, beans, toilet paper, napkins, cookies, soup, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
El comité "Barrio Alegre" se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio de las miembros. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Dora es Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica al comercio y en su hora libre se desempeña como peluquera funcionaria. Su deseo es progresar con la Fundación Paraguaya y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera muchos beneficio más que la Fundación le están ofreciendo continuamente.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, esmaltes y demás. Agradecen todas ellas por la oportunidad que les han dado.
texts.en:
The "Barrio Alegre" [Happy Neighborhood] committee came about as a result of advertising done in the members' neighborhood. All the members are from the same area, neighbors and acquaintances of the area. They each share the objective of working, helping create a spirit of mutual support, and arriving at the program's highest level. 

Ms. Dora is the group's chair. She earns a living in commerce and in her free time works as a beauty salon employee. She wishes to progress with Fundación Paraguaya and hopes the group may be strengthened day by day. She asserts that she is quite happy in her committee and expects many additional benefits as the Foundation is offering them on a regular basis.

She seeks a loan in order to purchase supplies for the beauty salon, such as shampoo, rinses, hair coloring, nail polish and other items. They all appreciate the opportunity that has been given them.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her work at a hair salon.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
8 de Diciembre es el grupo que se formó con la unión de 18 integrantes  en donde todas trabajan en una profesión por mas pequeña que sea, la cual les ayudan a poder ayudar a sus familias e hijos. las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en quipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas su mayor fortaleza.
Emilce es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual comenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena pasta para la venta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien día a día se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo como comerciante. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The '8 de Diciembre' community bank was formed when its 18 members came together to create a group.  Each group member works in a business, no matter how small, which allows them to help their families and children.  The ladies feel very excited.  Their mutual support is constant and they are inspired to keep working hard for their families and working as a team.  The fact that they use all the resources available to them makes their hard work their greatest strength.

Emilce is one of this group's members.  She says that her business is selling all kinds of clothing.  She says that her business is doing very well because she is very skilled at selling things.  She is a very hard-working and tenacious woman who works hard every day so that she can provide her family with the best.

Emilce is requesting a loan to buy clothing.  This will enable her to continue working and growing as a saleswoman.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that her group is receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eligió está casado con la Sra. Porfiria  hace varios años, tienen 1 hijo, el cual es la razón de lucha de la pareja.  Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está en Ciudad del Este; se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando  educan a su hijo y compran las comodidades del hogar. El Sr. Eligió además de la despensa trabaja como como guardia de seguridad en una estación de servicio en su comunidad.
Eligio solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en:
Mr. Eligio has been married to Ms. Porfiria for a number of years, and they have one child who is the motive for the couple's hard work. Together they set up a pantry in their home, which is in Ciudad del Este. They started out with a small amount of capital obtained from other jobs they had worked previously as salaried employees. Thanks to the work they are doing, they have paid for their son's education and purchased the household's needs. Mr. Eligio, in addition to the pantry, works as a security guard at a service station in his community. 

Eligio is seeking the loan for the purchase of groceries, beverages and other supplies needed for stocking his business. He thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his pantry.

loans.name: Dinia Marleny

texts.es:
La Sra. Dinia, tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera de 1 hijo con el que vive en Los Trojes, en el departamento de El Paraiso. Se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa americana usada Clasificada. Negocio que cuenta con  más de 1 año de experiencia en la administración. 

Ella está solicitando el crédito para compra cuatro fardos de ropa mixta para surtir su negocio y así ofrecerle variedad de prendas de vestir a su gran clientela y a su vez incrementar sus ganancias para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dinia is 21 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son with whom she lives in Los Trojes, in El Paraiso department.  Dinia is a saleswoman and her main business activity is selling pre-sorted, used, American clothing.  She has more than one year's experience in running her business.

Dinia is requesting a loan to buy four bundles of mixed clothing to stock her business so that she can offer a variety of garments to her large number of customers and so increase her profits.  This will enable her to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy American clothing to sell in her community

loans.name: Pablo Ramiro

texts.es:
Don Pablo  tiene 50 años de edad y está casado. Se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería (Ropa y Calzado)  cuenta con 20  años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, a su vez se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción.

En estos momentos el Sr. Pablo necesita del apoyo del crédito para comprar mercadería como ser: pantalón de dama, de varón y calzado escolar, para surtir mas su negocio para así incrementar sus ingresos y satisfacer a sus  clientes en variedad de prendas para vestir y calzado.
texts.en:
Don Pablo  is 50 years old and married.  He is a trader, and his main activity is selling clothes and shoes.  He has twenty years of experience in managing his business.  He also sells construction materials.

At the moment, Pablo needs credit to buy more merchandise, such as women's and men's trousers and school shoes so as to give a spur to his business and thereby generate more income and also satisfy his clients with a greater variety of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Santos Gertrudiz

texts.es:
La Señora Santos Gertrudis  tiene 52  años de edad soltera, vive en El Paraiso, Honduras. Se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería (Ropa usada)  con 2  años de experiencia. 

En estos momentos la Sra. Santos necesita del apoyo del crédito para la compra de mercadería como ser: pantalón de dama, shorts, camisetas, calcetas, para surtir mas su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en variedad de prendas  para vestir y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos Gertrudis is 52 years old.  She is single and lives in El Paraiso, Honduras.  Her main business activity is selling merchandise (used clothing).  She has two years experience.

Right now, Santos needs the support of a loan to buy merchandise such as ladies' pants (trousers), shorts, t-shirts and socks to further stock her business so that she can meet her customer demand by providing a variety of garments.  This will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy American clothing to sell in her business

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Don Gustavo tiene 54 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de El Paraiso. Vive con su compañera de hogar y es padre de 2 hijos. Don Gustavo es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (Pulpería)  que recibe el nombre de “PULPERIA ASTRID” contando con más de 11 años de experiencia.

El Sr. Gustavo está solicitando de la ayuda del crédito para invertir en su negocio como ser: productos de la canasta básica; arroz, manteca, azúcar, café, etc. y así incrementar sus ganancias y  satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Gustavo is 54 years old and resides in the city of El Paraiso. He lives with his life companion and is the father of two children. Don Gustuvo is a merchant and his primary business is selling groceries at his store named "Pulpería Astrid" [Astrid's Grocery] having over 11 years of experience. 

Mr. Gustavo is seeking help from the loan in order to invest in his business, purchasing basic staples such as rice, lard, sugar, coffee, etc., and so to increase his earnings and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (sugar, rice, lard and dairy products) for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is forty-five years old, married, and has three children.

Ali has owned a food market since 2004, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen se dedica a l confección de prendas de vestir tiene 63 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son 27, 31 y 39 años.  Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir hace 10 años, ella vive en la zona El Palmar, donde también es su taller de confección,  Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carmen va a usar este préstamo para la Compra de materiales (Tela, hilo, entretela y otros) para la confección de prendas de vestir ya que tiene un pedido que entregar, Carmen  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  Falta de espacio de trabajo y ya con los beneficios del crédito realizara la Construcción de barda para la fachada de la casa, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen's business is making clothes.  She is 63 years old, married, and has three children who are 27, 31 and 39 years old.  Carmen has been making clothes for ten years.  She lives in El Palmar district which is also where she has her dressmaking workshop.

This loan is Carmen's second with our institution.  She will use it to buy materials (fabric, thread, interlining, etc.) for making clothing as she has an order to fill.  Carmen faces challenges in her business such as a lack of work space.  With the profits from her loan, she will build an outer wall out the front of her home.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support that they have given her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials (fabric, thread, interlining, etc.)

loans.name: Fatima Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima  tiene 29 años y es Soltera con 2 hijos que son 7 y 10 años.  Ella tiene un kiosco Snack  donde vende variedad de bocaditos, comida sándwich, que se encuentran en la zona El Palmar. Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia que tiene con la institución, La Sra. Fátima va a usar este préstamo  para la Compra de insumos (Harina, queso, manteca, mortadela y otros) para su negocio. Por esta razón solicita este préstamo ya que su objetivo es hacer crecer  su negocio y generar mas ingresos,  Fátima enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  Falta de equipo eléctricos de trabajo (sumidora para hacer jugos y otros) ya que poco a poco ira adquiriendo con los beneficios del crédito, su deseo es  Comprar un lote de terreno y poco a poco hacer construir su casita y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Fátima is 29 years old, single and has two children aged 7 and 10 years. She has a snack bar where she sells a variety of snacks and sandwiches in the El Palmar area. This loan is her second cycle with the institution. Ms. Fátima will use this loan to purchase supplies (flour, cheese, lard, bologna and other items) for her business. For this reason she is seeking this loan, since her objective is to make her business grow and generate more income. 

Fátima faces challenges in her business such as a lack of electric appliances (a juicer for making juices among others) since she will go about acquiring the benefits of the loan little by little. Her desire is to purchase a plot of land and, a little at a time, have her house built, and thus provide greater comfort to her children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (flour, cheese, lard, bologna and other items).

loans.name: Nasem

texts.en: Nasem is forty-one years old. He is a married man from Gaza. On April 1st 2011 he opened a shop in which he repairs motorcycles. Nasem hopes that with this loan he will able to purchase equipment and re-decorate his shop. He hopes that this loan will improve his business and bring in more customers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and re-decorate his shop.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Amal heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina Isabel se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de producto de consumo popular y  granos básicos. Su negocio se denomina Pulpería ENID. Ella tiene 32 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio  ella lo atiende personalmente por lo tanto es bien administrado y durante todo este tiempo se ve que lo ha manejado muy bien.
En esta ocasión está solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercadería como ser arroz azúcar manteca carnes y embutidos). Doña Reina es una persona muy reconocida en la comunidad por su espíritu de superación.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel is a saleswoman.  Her main business activity is selling basic household products and basic grains.  Her business is called 'Pulpería ENID' (ENID Grocery Store).  She has been in this type of business for 32 years and serves in her store herself so it is well run.  Over the years she has managed it very well.

On this occasion, Reina Isabel is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, butter, meat and cold cuts.  She is a very well-known person in her community because of her desire to do well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, butter, meat and cold cuts) to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Mayra Maricela

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer de 41 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio de tricimoto (aparece en la foto con su esposo). 

Su historia empezó cuando la señora ayudaba al papa en el negocio de alquiler de duchas en la playa ya que el esposo trabajaba comprando y vendiendo pesca, su trabajo lo hace solo el esposo de la conjugue conduce la tricimoto en horario de7:00 de la mañana a 13:00 en la tarde y de 14:00 a 18:00 dependiendo del movimiento que genera el cantón a nivel turístico, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está en unión libre y su conjugue trabajaba manejando la tricimoto, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es la señora en un futuro poder adquirir otra tricimoto y mejorara su nivel de vida. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su servicio de tricimoto.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 41-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her motorcycle taxi business over the next few years (she appears in the photo with her husband).

Mayra's business story began when she used to help her dad in his business renting out showers on the beach and her husband worked buying and selling fish.

Mayra's husband drives the motorcycle taxi between 7.00am and 1.00pm and from 2.00pm to 6.00pm, depending on how busy the area is with tourists.  The difficulty they face is crime.  Mayra has a common-law marriage and her husband manages the motorcycle taxi.  The couple do not have any children.  Mayra's biggest dream for the future is to acquire another motorcycle taxi and improve her quality of life.  She would like this loan for the motorcycle taxi service.

loans.use: to buy tires and tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is forty-three years old, married, and has three children.

Ali has owned a metal-workshop, making windows and doors, since 2007. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan. He is aiming to get more profit so that he is able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Melba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Melba del Carmen, reside en el departamento de Masaya, tiene cuatro años de trabajar en la  elaboración de tortillas, ella empezó trabajando para otra persona, una mujer que no se rinde tan fácil que se levanta desde muy temprano para empezar su labor diaria.  

Gracias a sus esfuerzo a logrado independizarse,  actualmente tiene su propio negocio de  venta de tortillas, en donde ofrece también cuajadas, frijoles, leche agria, todo para un delicioso desayuno, con muy buena atención  personalizada, con el carisma que la caracteriza brindando así un  servicio completo a sus clientes.

Se presentó a Ceprodel  para solicitar un crédito,  para la compra de maíz, comal, cuajada, frijoles y leña, debido que esta teniendo mucha demanda, y quiere, invertir más al  negocio esto le ayudara a tener un mejor capital de trabajo,  así obtendrá mejores ingresos para su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melba del Carmen lives in Masaya department.  She has been making tortillas for a living for four years.  She started out working for somebody else.  Melba del Carmen is a woman who does not give up easily.  She gets up very early every morning to start her day's work.

Thanks to her efforts, Melba del Carmen managed to start working for herself.  She currently has her own business selling tortillas.  She also offers curds, beans and 'leche agria' (a fermented milk drink), everything for a delicious breakfast.  She provides a very good, personal service with the charm that she is noted for.  She provides her customers with a complete service.

Melba del Carmen came to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy corn, a tortilla pan, curds, beans and firewood as she is experiencing a lot of demand and she would like to invest more in her business.  This will help her to have better working capital and she will make better income which will enable her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, a tortilla pan, curds, beans and firewood

loans.name: Evelyn Del Socorro

texts.es:
Evelyn madre de familia, comerciante, casada, sus proyectos es mejorar y terminar la construcción de la infraestructura de su vivienda, ya que tiene partes construida y mejorar su nivel de vida. Tiene su negocio de ventas de cosméticos, perfume y más, siendo un ingreso al hogar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Tiene su negocio desde hace un tiempo, iniciándolo con fondo propios. Mediante su forma de ventas por encargos por catalogo y los productos que tiene en existencia, le facilitad poder cuidar a su hija y no tener que dejarla sola para trabajar a fuera de casa. 
La financiera le ha permitido la oportunidad de iniciar a cumplir sus proyectos y planes de seguir construyendo su vivienda. Con el préstamo solicitado comprara: cemento, hierro, arena, piedrín, bloques, piedras canteras, tablones de madera, estribu entre otros materiales para la construcción de las paredes. Agradece el financiamiento con el cual obtendrá seguridad y comodidad para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a mother, merchant, and married; her project is to improve and finish the construction of her home, as she has portions that are built.  She wants to improve her standard of living.  She has a business selling cosmetics, perfumes, and other items, which brings income to the home.  She counts on the support of her husband.

She has had her business for some time, having started it with her own funds.  Selling through catalog orders, as well as the existing products she has, facilitates her caring for her daughter and not having to leave her alone in order to work outside the home.  The financing has afforded her the opportunity to begin to complete her projects and the plans for continuing to build her house.

She will use the requested loan to buy:  cement, iron, sand, gravel, cinderblocks, quarry stone, wooden beams, cement, among other materials for building the walls.  She is grateful for the financing, with which she will obtain security and comfort for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Ana es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a las ventas de ropas para adultos, niños y damas.  Ella tiene  2 hijos y su marido es comerciante. Ella tiene muy buenas ventas, ya que siempre tienen muy buena calidad las prendas que vende, y gracias a eso ya ha podido hacerse de buena clientela.  Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de de ropas para adultos, niños y damas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Entrepreneurial Women” was formed through the union of various neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of the members of the group carry out independent activities, but also do activities that fortify their camaraderie.

Ana is one of the members of the group.  She dedicates herself to selling children for adults, children and women.  She has 2 children and her husband is a merchant.  She has very good sales given that she carries high-quality products to sell and, thanks to this, she has been able to establish a good client base.

She finds herself very satisfied with her activity and the training that the group receives.  She requests a loan to buy clothing for adults, children and women, with which she will be able to supply her business and have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Orfilia

texts.es:
Doña Orfilia se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la prestación de servicios de fotocopiado y papelería, así mismo posee una venta de insumos agrícolas y veterinarios denominado “Agropecuaria Matazano y papelería Joshua”.

Cuenta con mas de 4 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad comercial, nos esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de útiles escolares y productos agrícolas y veterinarios  como ser  herbicidas, desparasitantes vitaminas, anabólicos y alimentos concentrados ya que desea tener variedad de estos productos y así darle una mejor atención a sus clientes logrando mejor sus ventas, este es su tercer crédito con nuestra institución teniendo un buen comportamiento de pago .
texts.en:
Doña Orfilia owns a retail business.  She sells a mix of products and services that include, on one hand, paper sales and copier services and, on the other, sales of farming and veterinary supplies.  The business is called Matazano Farming & Joshua Office Supply.  

Doña Orfilia has operated the business for more than 4 years.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy school supplies and supplies for farming businesses--herbicides, insecticides, fertilizers, etc.--because she wants a range of products to sell to her customers.  This is Doña Orfilia's third loan from our institution and we note that she has a good payment record.

loans.use: to stock her retail businesses.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El sr  Arturo   es una persona  muy inteligente  y  dedicada a su negocio propio, el cual es una venta  de  pescado o mariscos  en  varios  lugares  de  la  zona  de  la  Chorrera  Namasigüe en el   departamento de Choluteca. Ha tenido este negocio desde ya hace mas de 15 años. 
En cuanto a su vida familiar, es padre de 4 hijos  los  cuales los tiene  en un centro educativo de su  caserío además cuenta con el apoyo  de  su  esposa  e  hijos  que también  le  ayuda  en  el  negocio  de nacatamales. En su tiempo libre se dedica  a  la  crianza  de  gallinas  y  cerdos como una fuente de ingresos adicional para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Arturo is a very intelligent person who is committed to his business selling fish and seafood in several places around Chorrea Namasigüe area, in Choluteca department. He has been in this business for more than 15 years. As regards his family life, Arturo is the father of four children who are attending a school in his village. In addition, he has the support of his wife and children who help him in his business selling nacatamales. In his free time Arturo also raises hens and pigs. This is an additional source of income for supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and crabs to sell

loans.name: Ester Consuelo

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Ester  es una persona muy especial, inteligente  y  dedicada a su negocio propio. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta  de  cerdos  en  varios  lugares  de  la  zona  de  la  Chorrera  Namasigüe en el  departamento de Choluteca. 
Ella ha realizado esta actividad desde ya hace mas de 18 años, es madre de 6 hijos  los  cuales ya son mayores  de  edad  que  también  le  ayudan  en  este  tipo  de  negocio  además cuenta con el apoyo  de  su  esposo   que  se  dedica  la  agricultura.  Su tiempo libre lo dedica  a  la  crianza  de  gallinas  y  cerdos como una manera de conseguir ingresos adicionales para sostener su casa.  En este caso está solicitando este préstamo para comprar cerdos y venderlos más adelante.
texts.en:
Ester is a very special, intelligent person who is committed to her business buying and selling pigs.  She carries out her business in several places around Chorrera Namasigüe district, in Choluteca department.

Ester has been engaged in this business activity for more than 18 years.  She is the mother of six children who are now adults and help her in her business.  She also has the support of her husband who is a farmer.  Ester spends her spare time raising hens and pigs as a way of making additional income to support her household.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy pigs which she will sell later.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell later

loans.name: Keelin Ibeth

texts.es:
Doña Keelin, tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su compañero de hogar con el que tienen 2 hijos. Keelin se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería. 
En estos momentos la Sra. Keelin  necesita de la ayuda del crédito para comprar mercadería como ser: Camisas, Pantalones, Faldas calzado para niños y adulto, para surtir mas su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos y obtener más clientes por ofrecer variedad de prendas para vestir. Con esta inversión espera unos retornos mayores y así poder garantizar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Keelin, aged 26, lives with her life partner, with whom she has two children. She is a merchant and her main activity consists in selling clothes and footwear.

Currently Keelin needs financial assistance to buy merchandise, such as shirts, pants, skirts and footwear for children and adults to stock up her business, increase her income and have more customers to whom she can offer a larger range of clothes. With this investment she expects a higher financial return in order to ensure her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts and footwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas es el grupo que se formó con la unión de 16 amigas de la ciudad de San Pedro. Ellas han visto una gran oportunidad de crecimiento y desarrollo para ellas y sus familias, desean darles lo mejor y que no pasen por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar, es por ello que día a día dan lo que pueden por cumplir con sus metas.
Catalina vende comidas de todo tipo de manera ambulante, y nos comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de sus comidas, ya tiene una clientela formada que siempre compra de ella lo que vende. Ella día a día se esfuerza para poder ir mejorando e ir dando na mejor atención y variedad a sus clientes. Su meta es poder tener un local grande, ya que ya no tenga que vender en forma ambulante.
Catalina solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, jamón, queso, verduras y demás insumos que necesita para seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Ella está contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group “United Women” was formed through the union of 16 friends from the city of San Pedro.  They have seen a great opportunity to grow and develop for themselves and their families.  They want to give them all the best, and don’t want them to go through the struggles they had to endure.  It’s for these reasons that they give all they can on a daily basis to meet their goals.

Catalina sells all types of foods as a street vendor.  She tells us that, thanks to the excellent quality of her food, she has an established customer base that always buys what she offers for sale.  She puts forth a great effort every day to keep improving, and to give the best attention and variety to her clients.

Her goal is to be able to have a large location, in order to no longer have to work as a street vendor.  Catalina requests the loan to buy meat, chicken, ham, cheese, vegetables, and the other supplies she needs to keep making the foods she sells.  She is happy for the help she is receiving, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making the foods she sells.

loans.name: Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es: La Sra. Yascara es la presidenta del Banco de emprendimiento PERLAS DEL SUR tiene 38 años de edad tiene pareja pero no es casada, tiene 1 hijo que tiene 5 meses de edad, ella es artesana ya que realiza  producción de artesanía, collares de forma manual, su domicilio se encuentra en la zona Palmeras,  Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con  Emprender, utilizara  este préstamo para  la compra de material para la fabricación de sus artesanías, y así de esta manera incrementar su  capital de trabajo y  mejorar sus ingresos,  Yascara enfrenta retos en su negocio que son falta de actualización en lo artesanal donde constantemente tiene que ir actualizándose,  utilizara los beneficios del crédito para seguir mejorando su trabajo. El sueño de la Sra. Yascara es tener una tienda en el centro de santa cruz para poder exponer su trabajo que son de buena calidad.
texts.en: Sra. Yascara, 38, is the president of the PERLAS DEL SUR community bank.	 She and her partner have a 5-month old child.  She lives in Palmeras and operates a business making and selling necklaces.  This is Sra. Yascara's first Emprender loan and she will use it to buy material for making necklaces.  The investment will allow her to increase her working capital and increase her income.  Sra. Yascara says that she has to train constantly in order to maintain her skills and a lack of training resources is a problem for her.  She will use the loan to improve her work.  She says that her long-term goal is to open a store in Santa Cruz.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making necklaces.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman, with eight children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Florencia has been in the business of seaweed farming for 15 years. She earns about PHP 5,000 per month from her business. Florencia also owns and manages a small sari-sari store business. She sells items like instant noodles, coffee, sugar, and canned goods. Florencia is able to support her family on her income.

Florencia is asking for a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings and more items to sell. Florencia is hoping to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and more items to sell

loans.name: Blanca Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Blanca,  se dedica a su negocio de Venta de Ropa Nueva, como ser, Jeans, camisas, faldas,  shores, carteras y todo lo que sus clientes le piden, ella se desplaza por varios caseríos del Departamento de Choluteca,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, es una mujer soltera, vive con su papa y mama, gracias a sus ingresos juntos han logrado salir adelante, algunas veces sale a visitar algunos familiares a la ciudad y aprovecha para llevar mercadería y vender.
Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 6,000.00, el cual invertirá en la compra de pantalones, camisas,  uniformes escolares y otra mercadería, espera que la institución pueda apoyarla y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is a young lady who sells new clothing, such as jeans, shirts, skirts, shorts, wallets and anything that her customers ask for. She hawks through several hamlets of the department of Choluteca, and has been in this activity for the past four years. She is a single woman and lives with her mom and dad. Her income enabled her to get ahead. Sometimes she pays her relatives in the city a visit and takes advantage of the opportunity to sell a few clothes that she has taken with her.

Blanca applies for a loan of 6000 lempiras to buy pants, shirts, school uniforms and other merchandise. She hopes that the microfinance institution Prisma Honduras can support her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Guadalupe Mariela

texts.es:
Doña Guadalupe Mariela,  originaria del  departamento de Masaya, tiene tres años de experiencia  como comerciante, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada.

  La mayoría de sus clientes son de Masaya que venden en el mercado municipal, los productos que ella comercializa los trae desde  costa rica, y una parte que  compra en Nicaragua. Entre ellos tenemos productos de la Avon y la zermat, es una mujer emprendedora, con muchos deseos de crecer. 

Se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito,  para la compra de maquillajes, perfumes, ropa para damas, bisutería de plata. Mercadería  que necesita para surtir  más  su negocio, y poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene. De esta manera dar un mejor servicio. Esto le ayudara a obtener mejores   ingresos para  su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para una vida digna con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Guadalupe Mariela, a native of Masaya, has operated her retail business for three years.  Her immediate family includes three others.  Her neighbors consider her to be honest and hard-working.

The majority of her customers live in Masaya and work in the local market.  She buys some of the products she sells in Costa Rica and the rest in Nicaragua.  She sells a range of products, some from Avon and Zermat.  She is an enterprising woman with a strong drive to grow her business.

Doña Guadalupe Mariela is applying to Ceprodel for a loan that she will use to buy products--makeup, perfumes, silver jewelry and women's clothing--to stock her business.  The investment will allow her to cover existing orders and meet future demand.  She says that the loan will help her to increase her income and, in turn, better provide for her family.

loans.use: to stock her beauty products business.

loans.name: Yoramu

texts.en:
Coffee farming is 48-year-old Yoramu’s business. It is a lucrative business by all accounts. Coffee was at one time Uganda's leading cash crop. Though focus has shifted away from coffee as the country's highest Forex earner (foreign exchange market) the past few years, it still remains a high value crop. Though coffee prices are invariably fluctuating, they stay within a reliable range for most coffee farmers here.

Yoramu plies his business in Bushenyi in the West of Uganda. The high spirited father of 4 has been in this business for 2 years now. He also earns more income from farming and teaching. He says he will bank on this Kiva loan to purchase more coffee seedlings to plant and also more coffee bags to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee seedlings to plant and also more coffee bags to resell.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
27-year-old Wilber has spent close to 4 years in a cattle and goat sales business in Bushenyi. He says it's been a worthwhile business venture so far due to the high demand for cattle and goats, not only in western Uganda but from central Uganda, too.
