Meat consumption, especially in the central parts of Uganda, has increased triple fold the last couple of years, and it's not surprising that business people like Wilber are making a killing in their trade. He runs his business under the auspices of a government agricultural advisory program. 

He envisages a situation in the future where he will be the leading supplier of cattle and goats to the leading markets in the West of Uganda. Farming is his other side source of sustenance. Wilber says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more cattle and goats to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and goats to resell.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: The last decade has been of paramount importance for 50-year-old Milton’s tea farming business in Bushenyi. He has made significant inroads in his business. The fact that he is able to sell his tea leaves to tea making factories in Bushenyi and beyond has greatly contributed to the growth of his business. On the side, this father of 10 also makes more income from milk sales. He says he will use his loan to purchase high grade manure to improve his tea farm yields.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure to improve his tea farm.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en: Fortunee, age 38, is a mother of 5 children. All her children go to school. She has requested the loan to buy more shoes for resale. She has been in the same business for one year. She plans to use the profits for renovating her house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Angel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Angel es una persona de 29 años, se destaca por ser trabajador, responsable, luchador y leal. Angel vive con su madre en la ciudad de Ambato que está ubicado en la provincia de Tungurahua en la sierra centro de Ecuador.

Angel se dedica a curtir o fabricar cuero que se obtiene de la piel de ganado después de un proceso, este cuero se utiliza para la confección de chompas, carteras, mochilas, zapatos, etc. Es el primer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de materia prima como pieles de ganado, para la producción de cuero debido a que quiere incrementar su negocio ya que tiene varios pedidos de fabricas de accesorios de cuero. Este proceso permitirá a Angel a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos que ayudarán a mantener su hogar.

Angel sueña con ser dueño de una fábrica de cuero y de productos del mismo.
texts.en:
Angel, 29, is known to be hard-working, responsible, persevering and loyal.  He lives with his mother in Ambato, a city in Tungurahua, a province in the central highlands of Ecuador.

Angel operates a leather tanning business.  He processes animal hides so that they can be sold on for making jackets, purses, backpacks, shoes, etc.  This is his first Fodemi loan and he will use it to buy the raw materials that he needs to grow his business.  He already has orders from factories that make leather goods and the investment will allow him to meet the orders and, in turn, increase his income.

Angel says that his long-term goal is to build a tanning factory and make leather products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his leather tanning business.

loans.name: Ines Teresa

texts.es: Inés es un mujer de 52 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de gas y detergentes su historia empezó por cuando viuda sus hijos le daban una mensualidad pero no insuficiente entonces decidió empezar a vender recorriendo sectores, su trabajo lo hace solo recorre sectores trabaja por la mañana, si tiene dificultades son los ladrones, está viuda, si tiene hijos todos son mayores, su sueño más importante es seguir mejorar su casa y tener un negocio mas grande en casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de gas y detergentes.
texts.en: Inés is 52 and has great hopes for coming years to expand her sales of gas and detergents.  Her story began when she was widowed, and when her children gave her a monthly allowance she decided to sell products locally.  She works in the mornings, alone, selling in different neighborhoods.  She faces many difficulties, including thieves, and being a widow with adult children, her dream is to fix up her house and grow her business at home.  She wants to invest this loan in stocking more gas and detergents.

loans.use: to buy gas and detergents.

loans.name: Karla Mariana

texts.es:
La joven Karla vive en el barrio la Providencia de la ciudad de Choluteca, en el sur de Honduras. Junto con ella viven sus 2 hijos y su esposo quien la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos. Karla es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada en toda su plenitud a su negocio propio, el cual es una venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años. 
En esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, pan, embutidos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo y tarjetas. Karla trabaja muy fuerte cada día para de esta manera crecer en su actividad y generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
Karla lives in la Providencia, a neighborhood of the city of Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She lives with her 2 children and her husband, who helps her meet her obligations. Karla is very hardworking and dedicated to her small business, which is a general store that she has run for the past 3 years. 
Karla now wishes to invest her credit in buying corn, beans, bread, rice, sugar, canned goods, oil, chicken and cards. She works hard every day to grow her business and to generate more income to improve her quality of life for the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, bread, rice, sugar, canned goods, oil, chicken and cards for her store.

loans.name: Hugo Raul

texts.es: Raúl es un hombre de 50 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio su historia empezó casi de todo la vida empiece ayudando a mi papa luego yo solo decide son transportista, su trabajo lo hace solo en algunos casos con un oficial mi horario depende del cliente, si tiene dificultades son los ladrones y las enfermedades,  está divorciado, si tiene un hijo, su sueño más importante es seguir trabajando y tener salud. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su servicio y asi comprar llantas y heramientas para su carro.
texts.en: Raúl is a 50-year-old man with big aspirations to make his business thrive. He has been doing this work for most of his life. He tells us that he began by helping his father, then decided to go it alone as a haulage driver. He normally does his job alone, although sometimes there is another worker with him. His working hours depend on the client. If he has any difficulties, it is with thieves or illness. He is divorced and has one son. His biggest dream is to keep working and to be healthy. Because of this, he has asked for a business loan so he can buy tyres and tools for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tyres and tools for his vehicle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 28 years old. She has two children and both of them attend school. She decided to reinvest the loan in the same business of shoes, which she has been running for the past 7 years. She has in mind to use the profits for house renovation.  She dreams of having a better business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nambuya's Group

texts.en:
Nambuya's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Nambuya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Nambuya has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flour for the business, and will help her to generate greater profits and buy food for feeding her family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Nambuya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Nambuya's future prospects by helping her to improve on her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour for the business.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.en: Florentine is 39 years old. She is a mother of two children, ages 4 and 9 years. She has been selling shoes in a local market for the last 15 years. She wants the loan to buy more shoes for resale. She plans to use the profits for expanding her business by making a reinvestment in the same business. She dreams of reaching a high loan amount in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
La  sr  Fausto  es una persona muy emprendedora y muy dedicada a su negocio propio, el cual es una pulpería  en  su casa de  habitación  en  el  caserío   la  Chorrera  Namasigüe en el   departamento de Choluteca. Ha manejado este negocio desde ya hace mas de 10 años, es padre de 3 hijos  los  cuales los tiene  en un centro educativo de su  caserío además cuenta con el apoyo  de  su  esposa  que también  le  ayuda  en  el  negocio. 
En esta ocasión Fausto invertirá el préstamo en la  compra  de  abarrotería  en  general, lácteos y granos  básicos para vender en su negocio y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sr. Fausto is an enterprising man.  He works hard to maintain his business, a corner grocery that he operates from a room in his house in Chorrera Namasigue, a small rural town in the "departamento" of Choluteca.  He has operated the business for more than 10 years.  Fausto has 3 children, all in a local school, and he can rely on his wife to help him with the business.  
Fausto will use this loan to stock his corner grocery with the everyday products that he sells.  The investment will allow him to increase his sales.

loans.use: to stock his corner grocery.

loans.name: Delmis Siomara

texts.es:
La señora Delmis de 42 años de edad es viuda y vive con sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de pulpería en donde vende productos como ser: jabón de baño, azúcar, granos básicos, refrescos, lácteos, artículos de aseo, etc. además tiene un negocio de comida en donde vende pollo frito, tacos y enchiladas los días viernes y sábado. Sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que le visitan a diario su negocio. 

En esta ocasión Delmis solicita un préstamo a prisma por la cantidad de 10,000.00 Lempiras. Este dinero lo necesita para compra de útiles escolares ya que estamos en la época de escuela y ella siempre vende estos productos para satisfacer siempre la necesidad de sus clientes. El sueño de doña Delmis es que sus dos hijas se gradúen de la universidad.
texts.en: Delmis is 42, a widow and lives with her 3 children. For the past 12 years she has run a small store, selling: soap, sugar, basic grains, soft drinks, milk products, cleaning products, etc.  She also prepares food to sell, such as fried chicken and enchiladas on Fridays and Saturdays. Her customers are neighbors and friends that visit her store daily.  Delmis seeks this credit from Prisma in the amount of 10,000.00 Lempiras.  She will use this credit to buy school supplies now that the school season has opened, and there is much demand for these items from her clients.  Her dream is that her children may attend and graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy school supplies during the school season, since there is much demand for these items from her clients.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 27 years old. She is married to a driver. They have two children. She has spent 5 years selling foodstuffs, and because of her business growth she decided to request a loan to add more items to the existing business, such as charcoal and cooking oil. With the profits, she plans to expand her business to the extent of becoming a sole supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zubeda's Group

texts.en:
Zubeda's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Zubeda is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her small business, which is selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zubeda has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Zubeda hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Zubeda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Zubeda's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwamini

texts.en: Mwamini is 29 years old. She sells ladies' clothes and has spent 3 years in the business. Her husband sells cell phone accessories as well as new model cell phones.  She wants to buy more ladies' clothes for resale. The profits that will be obtained from the business will be for building a house, since she already has a plot of land somewhere.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce for resale, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 45 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 18 years, Fred has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce for resale, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Energetic and dedicated, Alice is a 29-year-old mother of three children between one and nine years old. Her husband works as a businessman, while Alice has owned a bar for five years. Now requesting a loan to buy more beer for resale, she plans to use the profits to expand the business so that it becomes the best bar in the area.

loans.use: to buy more beer for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 31 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Asha has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Asha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale, and will help Asha to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Asha hopes that in the future she will be able to build more houses for rentals. 

Asha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Soroti region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Alice has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks for resale, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and improve on her standards of living. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more branches of the same business. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Martin has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Martin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Martin to generate greater profits and educate his children. Martin hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Martin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Martin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is 50 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. For the past 4 years, Edisa has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Edisa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale, and will help Edisa to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Edisa hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Edisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: Abudu

texts.en:
Abudu is 52 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 yaers, Abudu has been working hard to manage his small butchers, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Abudu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows for meat, and will help Abudu to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Abudu hopes that in the future he will be able to become a big supplier of meat in his area. 

Abudu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abudu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows for meat

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney, 32 years old, lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. A married father of one child who is currently in school, Sydney has been working hard to manage his clinic, which sells drugs, for the past three years.

To help expand his business, Sydney has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs and hospital equipment for the clinic, and will help Sydney to generate greater profits and pay school fess for his child. Sydney hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more equipment.

Sydney is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sydney who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs and hospital equipment for the clinic.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: La Srta.  Catherine  es conviviente, tiene 18  años de edad y una hija, Catherine estudia Gastronomía  en una instituto de prestigio, Catherine  escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene mucha creatividad para la cocina que le ayudara a desarrollarse profesionalmente, Su sueño de Catherine  es poner un restaurante  , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar prácticas profesionales y a su vez comprar implementos de cocina , Catherine cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Ms Catherine is 18 years old, has one daughter, and lives with her partner. She is studying gastronomy in a prestigious institute. Catherine has chosen this path which is also her vocation, and she has a lot of creativity for cooking that will help her grow professionally. Catherine's dream is to open a restaurant. In order to achieve this goal she is asking for a loan in order to take professional classes and purchase cooking materials. Catherine will achieve this with much work and effort, and with help from the loans from Edasprospo.

loans.use: take professional classes and purchase cooking materials

loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es: Carmen es un mujer de 32 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó desde pequeño le gusto vender, su trabajo lo hace con familiares desde las 6:00 hasta las 10:00, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda comprando enlatados, dulces, papaleria, etc.
texts.en: Carmen is a 32 year old woman who has great ambitions to grow her general store in the coming years. From a young age she always enjoyed selling, and she happily works alongside family members from 6 am to 10 pm. She is single, without children, and has a dream to own her home home. In order to achieve this she is asking for a loan to purchase greater quantities of canned goods, sweets, paper products, etc.

loans.use: purchase canned goods, sweets, paper products

loans.name: Maira Magdalena

texts.es: Maira es un mujer de 31 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó para ayudar la economía de su casa y escogí tienda porque no hay en el sector, su trabajo lo hace sola compra en el mercado lo que falta y los proveedores dejan la mercadería,  tiene dificultades el lodo en el invierno, está casada y su se dedica a chofer,  tiene 4 hijos están en escuela fiscal, su sueño más importante es superar mi negocio tener mas mercadería y arreglar la vivienda. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda comprando arroz, vegetales, enlatados, bebidas.
texts.en:
Maira is a thirty-one-year-old woman with high aspirations to make her store prosper over the next few years.  She started out to help the family financially, and chose to have a store because there weren't any in her area.  She works by herself, buys what she needs at the market, and suppliers drop the merchandise off.  Mud is a problem in winter.  

Maira is married to a driver and has four children in public school.  She says her greatest dreams are for the store to succeed, to have more merchandise, and to fix up her home.  She wants a loan to buy rice, vegetables, canned goods, and drinks for the store.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, canned goods, and drinks.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, deseosa de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Alexandra vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en Pelileo que se encuentra a 30 minutos de Ambato en la provincia de Tungurahua.

Alexandra trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de animales (cuyes), a este negocio le dedican mucho tiempo ya que es el único sustento que tienen para mantener y cubrir los gastos de su familia, es por eso que realiza su primer crédito en Fodemi, crédito en el cual van a invertir en la compra de cuyes de raza para reproducirlos y de esta manera podrá tener más cantidad y cuyes de calidad que son muy solicitados en el mercado.

Alexandra sueña con ser una distribuidora mayorista y tener un carro para realizarlo.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a responsible and very hard-working person who would like to provide for her children.  She lives with her two children and her husband in Pelileo which is located 30 minutes from Ambato, in Tungurahua province.

Alexandra works with her husband raising animals (guinea pigs).  They have been in this business for a long time and it is the only source of income they have for supporting their family and covering their expenses.  They are requesting their first loan from Fodemi and they will invest it in buying pure-bred guinea pigs to breed so that they will have a larger number of good-quality guinea pigs which are very much in demand in the market.

Alexandra dreams of becoming a wholesaler and owning a car with which to carry out that business.

loans.use: to buy pure-bred guinea pigs to breed

loans.name: Okitella

texts.en:
Okitella is 33 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Okitella has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Okitella has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce for resale, and will help Okitella to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Okitella hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Okitella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Okitella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Nasur

texts.en:
Nasur is 33 years old and married with 2 children living in Hioma, Uganda. He is a hardworking father who owns a spare parts business which he has been running for 10 years. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations. His goal for his family is to educate his children.

He hopes to expand his business to new markets. Nasur intends to use the loan to purchase spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is 31 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Phillip has been working hard to manage his salon, which does hairdressing. 

To help expand his business, Phillip has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a big screen television and will help Phillip to generate greater profits and then pay school fees for his children. Phillip hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children. 

Phillip is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Phillip who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase a big screen television

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 46 years old. He is married and a father of eight children. He diversified his video business and now he has ventured into produce buying and selling. However currently he is challenged by the high price fluctuations on the market. His family goal is to educate his children and he also wishes to expand his business to new markets. Jacob intends to use the loan to purchase agricultural produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce to sell.

loans.name: Kelin Janeth

texts.es:
La joven Kelin vive en la ciudad de Choluteca, en el sur de Honduras. Junto con ella vive su esposo y su madre quienes la respaldan en cada uno de sus compromisos. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio lo que es venta de tortillas y venta de cosméticos. 
Kelin realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años en diferentes barrios de esta ciudad, como también en su colonia, donde reside. En esta ocasión Kelin invertirá este préstamo en la compra de maíz, leña, cal, lociones, cremas y tintes para sus negocios. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus cliente trabaja muy fuerte para así de esta manera crecer día a día en su actividad y así generarse mejores ingresos para bríndale  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia .
texts.en: The young Kelin lives in the city of Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She lives with her husband and her mother, who supports her in each of her responsibilities. She is a very entrepreneurial person and has focused her retail activity on selling tortillas and cosmetics. She has been engaged in this activity for the past 5 years in different neighborhoods of the city as well as in her own neighborhood. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase maize, wood, lime, lotions, creams and dyes for her retail activity. She wakes up each day very early in order to tend to the needs of each of her customers, is a very hard worker, and is able to augment her retail activity a little bit each day. In this way she generates more profits and brings her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase maize, en la compra de maíz, wood, lime, lotions, creams and dyes for her retail activity

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 32 years old and a married father of 2 children living in Hoima, Uganda. He owns a produce business and he is a civil servant. Edison has been running this business for 3 years and it has helped in supplementing his salary. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations.

His goal for his family is to educate his children and renovate his residential house. He also wishes to diversify his business so as to spread the risks involved in the business he is doing right now.

Edison intends to use the loan to renovate his residential house.

loans.use: to renovate his residential house

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 27-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent home in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been riding a motorcycle for 4 years but working for another person. His challenge has been high fuel costs and having to remit 70% of his daily earnings to his boss.

His dream is buying a motorcycle and building a permanent house. Godfrey needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for a transport business

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Saidi used his previous loan to buy angle bars, welding rolls and mud plates for his workshop. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. His dream is to educate his children and modern his workshop. Saidi needs the loan to buy materials for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Mary Gorreti

texts.en: Mary Gorreti is a 40-year old single parent living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 20 years she has been growing and selling bananas. Her challenges have been price fluctuations and the current banana-wilt disease that has affected her plantation. Her dream is to educate her children and rehabilitate her banana plantation. Mary Gorreti needs the loan to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loans.name: Goodluck

texts.en: Goodluck is a 38-year old, married man with six children. He lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a driver and has been in this business for the last 10 years. His challenges have been high fuel and transportation costs. His dream is to educate his children and buy land on which to grow crops. Goodluck needs the loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hardworking, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an agriculturalist and has been in this business for the last 10 years. His challenges have been theft and seasonal weather. Julius' dream is to educate his children and buy land on which to grow more crops. Julius needs the loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Dagoberto Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dagoberto es un señor de 64 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y dos hijos uno de diez y el otro de once años de edad, en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde hace varios años que Dagoberto se dedica a la agricultura. El reparte su producto a la mayoría de los vecinos de su comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.

Actualmente Dagoberto está solicitando un microcrédito de₡550.000 (quinientos cincuenta mil colones), para la siembra de yuca uno de los mas deliciosos tubérculos en el país, también para comprar abono, para asi salir adelante con todos los gastos diarios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos a la hora de la cosecha. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Dagoberto es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is a 64-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and two children.  One of his children is 10 years old and the other is 11.  They live in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, in Alajuela province.  The main business activities in this area are livestock raising and farming, particularly growing pineapples which are sold on the international market.  For this reason, the community has been growing over recent years, creating a greater demand for products and services, and providing more work opportunities.

Dagoberto has been farming for several years.  He delivers his crops to the neighbors in his community who are very satisfied with their quality.

Dagoberto is currently requesting a micro loan for 550,000 colones which he will use to sow his cassava, one of the most delicious tubers in the country.  He will also buy manure.  This will help him to cover all his daily expenses and provide his family with a better quality of life.

Dagoberto is a member of the 'Mujeres al Éxito' Community Bank in La Trinchera de Pital.  This is one of 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  He hopes to use this loan to continue growing on a personal and financial level.  He will also participate actively in his community's loan organization.

loans.use: to sow cassava

loans.name: Alexandra Lucia

texts.es:
Alexandra es una mujer de 55 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida.

Su historia empezó con desayunos porque en el sector había un comité deportivo y posteriormente decidió poner o aumentar con almuerzos dejo de trabajar un año porque viajo y ha retornado desde el año pasado el negocio de venta de almuerzos, trabaja con su esposo inicia las 6:00 a comprar las legumbres y víveres y comienza a preparar los almuerzos, sus dificultades son el transporte para ir a comprar las legumbres y a la hora de entregar, está casada y el esposo es arreglador de muebles de madera y es quien me ayuda en el negocio, tiene 3 hijos todos son mayores de edad, su sueño es seguir trabajando con D-MIRO y aumentar nuevamente el negocio es el sustento de nuestro hogar. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en su venta de comida como granos, carnes, frutas, vegetales.
texts.en: Alexandra is a 55 year old woman who has big aspirations in the coming years to grow her retail activity of food sales. Her activity began with breakfasts because in her neighborhood there was a sports league, after which she added lunches. She stopped working for one year due to much travel but she returned a year ago and has since begun selling lunches. She works alongside her husband and begins at 6 am to purchase vegetables and supplies and begins to prepare the meals. Her challenge is transportation to go purchase the vegetables and when it's time to return home. Her husband puts together wooden furniture and helps her a lot in her business. They have three children all of whom are adults. Her dream is to continue working with D-MIRO and increase her business activity from her home. In order to achieve this she is asking for a loan to invest in her food sales by purchasing grains, meats, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: purchase grains, meats, fruits and vegetables to put together plates of food

loans.name: Lourdes Leida

texts.es: Lourdes es una mujer de 30 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio de comida su historia empezó desde que el gobierno le dio la casa ella decidió poner su comedor ya que hay muchas operaciones de alimentación y escogió porque cocino rico, su trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de su hijo de 7:00 hasta las 2:00, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, si tiene2 hijos son mayores, su sueño más importante es implementar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su servicio de comida y asi comprarcarnes, frutas, vegetales, granos para tener mas variedad de comidas
texts.en:
Lourdes is a thirty-year-old woman with high aspirations to make her food service business prosper in the coming years.  She got started when the government gave her the house and she decided to open a food business because lots of people buy meals, and she's a good cook.  Her son helps her out between 7 and 2.  She does have a problem with crime.

Lourdes is not married and has two grown children.  Her greatest dreams are to run her business and that her children become professionals. She is seeking a loan for her food service.  She'll buy meat, fruit, vegetables, and grains so she can offer a wider assortment.

loans.use: to buy meat, fruit, vegetables, and grains for food preparation.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 24 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio su historia empezó hace 2 años con esta actividad en la zona pertenece a una cooperativa brondando el servicio de transporte de personas en la cuidad el señor tenía una moto con la que empezó esta actividad, su trabajo lo hace solo elabora de lunes a domingo desde las 7 am hasta la 7 pm, no tiene dificultades, está en unión libre y su esposa pasa en su casa, tiene 4 hijos, su sueño más importante es mejorar su vivienda. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su servicio y asi comprar herramientas y llantas para la moto.
texts.en:
Luis is a 24-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business over the next few years.

Luis started working in his business two years ago.  He belongs to a drivers' cooperative and provides a passenger transport service in the city.  Luis had a motorcycle with which he started out in this business.  He works alone from Monday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 7.00pm, and does not experience any difficulties.

Luis lives with his common-law wife who takes care of their home.  They have four children and Luis' biggest dream is to improve his home.  He would like this loan for his taxi business, to buy tools and tires for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy tools and tires for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 39 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de zapato y Avon su historia empezó después de separarse de su ex conyugue decidió tomar un curso de manualidades donde aprendió hacer zapatillas y desde ese entonces se dedico a vender sandalias, su trabajo lo hace sola durante toda la semana, tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, está separada, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es poder agrandar mas su negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de zapato y Avon.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 39-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business selling sandals and Avon products over the next few years.

Rosa started her business after she separated from her ex-husband.  She decided to take a craft course where she learned to make sandals.  She then started selling sandals.  She works alone all week long.  The difficulty she faces is crime.

Rosa is single and doesn't have any children.  Her biggest dream is to further expand her business.  She would like this loan for her business selling sandals and Avon products.

loans.use: to buy sandals and perfume

loans.name: Badri

texts.en: Badri is 21 years old and lives in a small village in the Khoni District of West Georgia. He shares his home with his 72 year old grandmother. Badri works in his house and produces simple wooden furniture – chairs, tables, etc. He likes his job, but doesn’t have the financial resources to buy the wooden materials he needs to produce better quality goods which could be sold in the local market. The main source of the income for the family is a cow that produces milk. Badri’s grandmother makes cheese and sells it in the village. The family also gets social assistance from the local government, as they are estimated to live under the poverty line. The total average monthly income for the family, including social assistance, is 360 Laris. Badri is applying for this loan to buy more wooden materials so he can produce more and better quality furniture to sell in the Khoni Market. This will increase the family's income and improve its living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make wooden furniture.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 26 years old. He lives in village Kutiri, West Georgia with his family: wife (Shorena), 2-year-old daughter, and parents. The primary source of income for the family is a milk cow. Products of the cow are mainly consumed by the family members, but some surplus is sold locally. The family also owns 80 nut trees and sells nuts locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irakli requested credit to start a trade business. He will purchase clothes and various household goods on wholesale markets of the nearby towns, and sell them in his and close villages. The income of the family will significantly increase and Irakli will be able to create better living conditions for his daughter, as well as other family members.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household goods for resale

loans.name: Randall Alberto

texts.es:
Randall  vive con su esposo en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Randall desde hace unos meses atrás desea  adquirir un medio de transporte para movilizarse a su trabajo, pero requiere de este crédito para poder comprarlo ya que en estos momentos sus  ingresos económicos son escasos. Necesita este transporte para continuar creciendo y para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Actualmente Randall está solicitando un microcrédito de 550,000.00 (quinientos cincuenta mil colones), para la compra de un automóvil para dirigirse a su lugar de trabajo y cumplir responsablemente con su deber como empleado, ya que le queda un poco lejos de su hogar.

Randall es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Randall lives with his wife in a small community named the Trinchera de Pital, which is in the Alajuela province.  His primary business activities are livestock and agriculture.  Growing pineapples stands out because they are mainly sold in international markets.

For this reason the development of the community has been growing in the past years.  This is generating a greater demand for products and services, which offers greater opportunities for work.

For several months Randall has wanted to get a means of transportation to get to his work.  However, he needs this loan to be able to buy an automobile.  At this time his income is scarce.  He needs this transportation to continue growing and to give his family a better quality of life.

Randall is currently requesting a microloan for 555,0000 colones to buy an automobile to get to his work place and to responsibly complete his duties as an employee.  He is a bit far from his home.

Randall is a member of Trinchera de Pital's "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito" (Community Venture of Successful Women), one of EDESA's 150 member organizations in Costa Rica. 

With this loan he hopes to continue growing on a personal and a financial level.  He also hopes to actively participate in the loan organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy an automobile.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 35 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de Yambal y articulo de hogar su historia empezó desde que era joven vendí mercadería y escogió porque su mama también se dedicaba a este negocio, su trabajo lo hace sola se levanta a las 9:00 hasta las 17:00, tiene dificultades es la delincuencia, está casada su esposo trabaja en una empresa, si tiene2 hijos, su sueño más importante es terminar de criar a sus hijos y tener dinero. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de Yambal y asi comprar mercaderia como perfumes y aticulos de hogar.
texts.en:
María is a 35-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business selling Yanbal products and household goods over the next few years.

María started working when she was young, selling merchandise.  She chose this line of work because her mom did the same thing.  María works alone from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  The difficulty she faces is crime.  She is married and her husband works for a company.  They have two children.

María's biggest dreams are to finish bringing up her children and to have money.  She would like this loan to invest in her business selling Yanbal products.  She will buy merchandise such as perfume and household goods.

loans.use: to buy perfume and household goods

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer de 60 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda y bazar su historia empezó hace 7 años ya que sintió la necesidad de trabajar para poder sustentar a su familia, su trabajo lo hace con el esposo, no tiene dificultades, está casada su esposo trabaja en el negocio, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es desear para su negocio incrementar mas y para sus hijos que tengan trabajo estable. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y bazar.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 60-year-old woman who has great aspirations for growing her store that sells stationery and other items over the next few years.  Her story began seven years ago, as she felt the need to work to be able to support her family.  She works alongside her husband, and faces no difficulties.  She is married, and her husband works in the business.  She has children.

Her most important dream is that she wants her business to grow further, and for her children to to have stable employment.  For this reason she wants the loan for her store that sells stationery and other items.

loans.use: to purchase miscellaneous items and stationery for her store.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber vive con su esposo en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Wilber desde hace unos meses atrás desea avanzar un poco mas con la construcción de su casa, ya que se había detenido por falta de ingresos económicos. Desea vivir bajo un techo más seguro y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Actualmente Wilber está solicitando un microcrédito de 700,000.00 (setecientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción, para poder terminar su humilde y pequeño hogar, ya que le falta poner el piso y hacer las divisiones.

Wilber es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Wilber lives with his wife in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela.  The main economic activities of this province are livestock and agriculture, in particular growing pineapple, which is mainly sold to international markets.  For this reason, the development of the community has seen growth in recent years, generating an increased demand for products and service and providing more opportunities for employment.

For the last few months, Wilber has wanted to make some more progress on his home's construction, which he needed to halt due to lack of income.  He wants to live under a roof that's more secure, and to have a better quality of life.

Wilber is currently requesting a microloan of 700,000 (seven hundred thousand) colones, for the purchase of construction materials so that he can finish his small and humble home, as he needs to put down a floor and build the room dividers.

Wilber is a member of the "Mujeres al Éxito" ["Women Heading to Success"] communal bank in La Trinchera de Pital.  This is one of 150 member organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan, he hopes to continue growing to the next level on a personal and financial basis, and also to actively participate in the lending organization in his community.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for completing his home.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transportation. The challenge he faces is that of finding customers. His dream is to educate his children, build a permanent home, and buy land to grow crops. Emmanuel needs this loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 35 años de edad es casado y tiene 3 hijos, tiene casa propia en la que viven y esta ubicada en un caserío rural de nombre “Hualtaco II” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Piura, caserío en el cual se dedican sus habitantes a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente, es pequeño por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Actualmente Augusto al igual que muchos de sus vecinos ha decidido dedicarse a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovinos los cuales les da los cuidados que merecen hasta que alcancen el peso y tamaño ideal para ofrecerlos o comercializarlos en los mercados de los caserío aledaños, pues ya tiene sus clientes a quienes visita después de un determinado tiempo con la seguridad de que podrán comprarle sus animales, adicionalmente también se dedica a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 1has de terreno agrícola en donde ha sembrado mango y limón, productos los cuales cosecha semanalmente.

Augusto esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales los destinara para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento de sus animales y poder ofrecerlos a mejor precio, y es que las utilidades que obtenga le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y cumplir con las cuotas del crédito. Pues se sabes que muy responsable por lo que anteriormente ha sido cliente nuestro.
texts.en:
Augusto is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in his own home, in a small rural village called "Hualtaco II", in Tambogrande district, in Piura province.  The people who live in this village all farm and raise livestock.  As the village is small, the only basic service they currently receive is electricity.

Augusto, in common with many of his neighbors, decided to work raising cattle and sheep.  He gives his animals the care they deserve until they reach an ideal weight and size, at which point he sells them in markets in neighboring villages.  He already has customers who he visits after a certain length of time, knowing for sure that they will buy his animals.  In addition, Augusto also farms.  He has one hectare of farmland where he has sown mangoes and lemons.  He harvests these products every week.

Augusto is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which he will be able to fatten his animals more quickly and sell them for a better price.  The profits he makes will allow him to improve his quality of life and repay his loan.  We know that Augusto is very responsible because he is an existing client of ours.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Cresencia Adalid

texts.es:
La  señora Cresencia  es una persona muy emprendedora y muy dedicada a su negocio propio. Su actividad productiva es la fabricación y venta  de  tortillas  actividad  que  realiza  en   su casa de  habitación  en la Colonia  Santa Lucia  del  Triunfo    en el departamento de Choluteca, en el sur de Honduras. 
Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 15 años, es madre de 3 hijos  los  cuales los tiene  en un centro educativo de su  colonia.  Además cuenta con el apoyo  de  su  esposo e hijos    que  también  se  dedican  al  comercio. En esta ocasión el préstamo será destinado a la compra de maiz, leña y cal para la producción de tortillas. Su tiempo libre lo dedica  a la  crianza  de  gallinas  y visitar  la  iglesia.
texts.en:
Señora Cresencia is a very enterprising woman, who is highly dedicated to her own business.  Her economic activity is making and selling tortillas, an activity which she undertakes in her home in the village of Santa Lucia  del  Triunfo, which is in the department of Choluteca in the southern part  of Hondaras.

She has been working in this activity for more than 15 years.  She is the mother of three children, who attend an educational center in her village.  She additionally has the help of her husband and children, who also work.

On this occasion, the loan will be used for the purchase of corn, firewood and lime for making tortillas.

loans.use: purchase of corn, firewood and lime for making tortillas.

loans.name: Gladys Del Rocío

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer casada, con un hijo de cinco años de edad, se describe como una persona trabajadora, alegre y muy responsable. Vive con su familia en Pelileo que se encuentra a 30 minutos de Ambato en la provincia de Tungurahua.

Gladys trabaja sola en la confección de jeans. Es el primer crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de una máquina de doble aguja, que facilitaría la producción de jeans y aumentaría su productividad, proceso que permitirá mejorar sus ingresos económicos que a su vez ayudarán a mejorar su calidad de vida y sustentar los gastos de su casa.

Gladys sueña con tener su propio taller de confección y poder emplear a personal.
texts.en:
Gladys is married, has a five year-old son, and is a very happy, hardworking, and responsible lady.  She lives with her family in Pelileo, located 30 minutes from Ambato, within the Tungurahua province.

Gladys makes jeans and works on her own.  This will be her first loan through Fodemi, which she will use to buy a double stitch sewing machine to make her jeans production easier and allow her to increase her productivity.  This will help her to increase her income, help improve her quality of life, and allow her to pay her household expenses.

Gladys dreams of having her own workshop where she can provide employment to others.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 39 year old farmer from a small village in West Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife, Khatia and two sons (11 and 1 years old). Zaur’s eldest son goes to school. The only source of the income for the family is a pig farm. They have 3 pigs and sell, on average, 30 piglets per year in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris. The family lives in poverty. 

Zaur has an old tractor, which is out of order and needs approximately 1200 USD for repairs. Zaur has requested credit to repair the tractor and make it functional. He will work on seasonal agricultural works in his and nearby villages to earn additional income. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to purchase additional household goods, to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tractor repair services.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 58 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo District with his wife, Makvala. The family grows 100 nut trees and sells the harvested nuts. Also, Makvala frequently travels to Turkey, where she gets temporary paid jobs. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris per month. They live in poverty. 

George owns a workshop for producing railings. He stopped operations at the workshop, as he didn’t have funds for purchasing working materials. Currently he has orders for railings. He requested credit for purchasing armature, sand and cement. George will re-start the operations at the workshop and get additional income. The family will be able to combat their poverty.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and armature for re-starting a construction workshop.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is from a small village in the Kakheti region. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband, Alex, and their four children (ages 7, 5, 4 and 2). Alex is the only income provider in the family. He works in a local sawmill and earns 300 Laris per month. The family lives in poverty. 

Maya used to have a trade business one year ago. But she sold all the goods and stopped the business because she needed funds to pay for a surgery on her child. 

Maya is requesting credit to purchase clothing for resale. Also, part of the credit will be used to purchase turkeys. Maya will start a small turkey-farming business to earn additional income through selling the turkeys. Maya will also be able to purchase needed goods for her children as well as household goods in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale and turkeys for farming.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 55 years old. He lives in the village of Gumati, West Georgia. He lives with his family: wife, Gulnara, and 25-year-old son. The family owns 0.5 hectares of land where maize is grown. He sells harvested maize to local retailers on the open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 laris.

Revaz used to run a grocery store in the village. As a result of lack of funding, he closed the store. Now Revaz requested a Kiva loan to restart the store. With the borrowed money, he will purchase grocery products for sale in the store. The family's income will increase. Revaz plans to invest part of their income in agriculture – he plans to grow vegetables on family-owned land instead of maize, as vegetable growing is more profitable. Another part of the income will be used for the family – they will purchase needed household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for restarting the village grocery store

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 48 years old. He lives in the Kutaisi District in the Imereti Region.  He is married and lives with his family: wife – Natia, 7-year-old daughter and father (90 years old).  Mamuka and Natia work as teachers in a local school. Their daughter goes to school.  Mamuka’s father is retired. The average monthly income for the family is 650 Laris, including the pension of Mamuka’s father.

Mamuka requested credit to restart a family-owned small poultry farm. He has all necessary equipment for the farm.  He stopped the business a year ago because of lack of means for turnover.  With the requested Kiva loan, Mamuka will purchase chickens and food for them. In 3 months, Mamuka will start selling the hens in a nearby town’s open market. The income of the family will significantly increase. Part of the increased income will be reinvested in the same business to expand it, and another part will be used for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 45 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. Aida is married and has a daughter, who is a student. Aida’s husband works as a builder. Aida has a higher pedagogical education and works at the Vanadzor branch of the state teachers' training institute as an archivist.
Aida’s daughter studies in Yerevan and is a student at the State Linguistic University. She is now in her third year and, on graduating from the university, she will be a qualified translator of English, Russian, and Armenian. Aida says that her daughter’s choice of profession was a very sound decision, as she will be able to find a job very quickly and easily, as demand for this profession is very high.  
Aida is asking for a 200,000 AMD loan to pay for her daughter's education for the second semester of the current academic year.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban is a 40-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a produce store and has worked for over eight years. He got capital from farming. The challenge he faces is that of customers not paying on time. His dream is to educate his children and diversify his business. Shaban needs this loan to buy maize and popcorn to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and popcorn to sell

loans.name: Abigaël Group

texts.fr: La cliente Odia, est  membre du groupe d’affaire «Abigaël »,jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 44  ans, mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un policier. Elle est  vendeuse de produits alimentaires et divers. Il y a  3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  4eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  les poissons, 1 carton de cigarette, etc.,  à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Odia is a member of the business group Abigaël. A young entrepreneur, she is 44 years old and married with six young children. Her husband is a police officer. She sells food products and other items, and has been practicing this income-generating activity for three years.
 
She has been granted her 4th loan from Hekima. She will use this new credit to buy fish, one carton of cigarettes, etc. for resale. 

She wants to see her children grow up comfortably, and she would also like to buy a plot of land. She wishes to thank Hekima for its efforts to help poor women who don’t have access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Merys Everilda

texts.es: Merys es un mujer de 45 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su servicio infantil su historia empezó por afán a los niños y porque me gusta tratar con ello, su trabajo lo hace con compañero del mismo tipo de trabajo, si tiene dificultades son  las enfermedades, está separada, si tiene 1 hijo, su sueño más importante es seguir trabajando y tener salud siempre lo mejor para mi. Por eso quiere el préstamo para construir mejor el centro infantil comprando cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Merys is 45 years old.  She has many aspirations for the coming years to prosper in her business of child care services.  Her story started with her love of children and how she likes to care for them.

She works with a colleague who does the same type of work.  If she has difficulties, they are the illnesses.

She is separated and has one child.  Her most important dream is to continue working and to always be in good health.

She wants the loan in order to improve the construction of the child center.  She will buy cement, sand, and cement blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and cement blocks.

loans.name: Maritza Alexandra

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 36 años, se describe como una persona alegre, trabajadora, con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su hijo. Maritza es viuda, vive con su hijo de 6 años en Pelileo que se encuentra a 30 minutos de Ambato en la provincia de Tungurahua.

Maritza trabaja con su hermana en la confección de jeans, es el primer crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de tela jean para confeccionar pantalones y también necesita entrar en el negocio de la crianza de animales debido a que lo que hace actualmente no le alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar, con esta inversión Maritza podrá incrementar su negocio y obtener buenas ventas e ingresos económicos.

Maritza sueña con terminar de construir su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 36-year-old woman, who describes herself as a happy and hard-working person with great desire to move her son ahead in life.  Maritza is widowed, and lives with her six-year-old son in Pelileo, which is 30 minutes away from Ambato in the province of Tungurahua.

Maritza works with her sister sewing jeans.  This is her first loan that she is taking through Fodemi, and it will be used for the purchase of denim for sewing pants.  She also needs to enter into the business of raising animals, as what she is currently doing is not sufficient to cover all her household needs.  With this investment, Maritza can grow her business and get good sales and income.

Maritza dreams of finishing construction of her home and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase denim to grow her business, and also to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad, su casa es propia y esta ubicada en el caserío rural de nombre “San Pablo Hualtaco II” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande en la Provincia de Piura. Caserío el cual por ahora solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica. 

Su actividad comercial de Luzmila es dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza Dupree y Avon, productos los cuales los ofrece recorriendo todos los días en los caseríos en los cuales ya tiene sus clientes que cada vez que necesitan sus productos se comunican dándole preferencia por la buena atención que brinda. Además también se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral los cuales también los ofrece de manera quincenal a sus clientes en el mercado local de su caserío.

Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para todas sus actividades a realizar, pues la unión y los objetivos planteados por ellos están bien definidos por lo que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles para la compra de mas productos de belleza y alimentos balanceados para aumentar sus ventas con lo que podrán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 27 years old, married, and has one dependent child.  She owns her own home in a small rural village called 'San Pablo Hualtaco II', in Tambogrande district, in Piura province.  The only basic service her village currently receives is electricity.

Luzmila's business activity is selling Dupree and Avon beauty products.  She sells her products every day, traveling round nearby villages.  She has customers there who contact her when they need her products.  They are loyal to her business because of the good customer service she provides.  Luzmila also raises farmyard birds which she sells every two weeks to her customers in the local market in her village.

Luzmila has her husband's support in all the activities she carries out.  The couple have a well-defined set of goals to achieve.  Luzmila is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and nutritionally-balanced feed so that she can increase her sales.  This will enable her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and nutritionally-balanced animal feed

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en: Felicien is 42 years old. He is single and owns a boutique. He sells different items in the store, which he has been running for the past three years. With the loan, he will buy more items to add for sale in the boutique, such as salt, soap, and beans. Felicien plans to use the profits for renovating the house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, a 40-year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda, owns a produce store that he has run for over 10 years, having obtained his capital from a retail shop that he used to operate. Robert, who faces the hardships of price fluctuation and inflation, is requesting this loan to buy maize to sell. His dreams include educating his children and hiring employees to help expand his business.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Besi Karolina

texts.es:
La joven Besi vive en la Colonia Gracias a Cristo de la ciudad de Choluteca, en el sur de Honduras. Junto con ella viven sus dos hijos y su esposo quien también comerciante y la apoya en cada uno de sus compromisos. Besi es una persona muy luchadora que se dedica en en 100% a su negocio propio que es la venta de abarrotería, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años en su colonia de residencia. 
En esta ocasión ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, pan, embutidos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo, tarjetas, churros, refrescos para vender en su negocio. La joven Besi es una persona muy honrada y responsable lucha muy fuerte todos los días para ir creciendo en su actividad y tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Besi is a young woman who lives in the Gracias a Cristo neighborhood in the city of Choluteca in the southern part of Honduras.  She lives with her two children and her husband, who is also a merchant.  He supports her in each one of her commitments.  

Besi is a very tenacious person who devotes herself 100% to her business of selling groceries.  She has been doing this in her neighborhood for four years.

This time she will use the loan to buy corn, beans, bread, sausages, rice, sugar, oil, chicken, cards, churros, and soft drinks to sell in her store.  Besi is a very honorable and responsible person who struggles very hard every day in order to continue growing in her business activity.  She also does this in order to have a better quality of life for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, bread, sausages, rice, sugar, oil, chicken, cards, churros, and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anaceli

texts.es:
Anaceli tiene 44 años de edad y vive en una comunidad llamada Osa, en la provincia de Puntarenas.  Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Desde hace varios meses, que Anaceli necesita arreglar la  infraestructura de su hogar y no lo ha realizado porque sus ingresos económicos no son suficientes. Pero su deseo es que su familia tengo un techo digno y seguro.

Anaceli está solicitando un monto de 550,000.00 (quinientos cincuenta mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción y pago de mano de obra, para arreglar las ventanas y puertas de su hogar. 

Anaceli es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Golfo Dulce S.A, una de las 150 empresas socias de la empresa y este será su segundo préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida, por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Anaceli is 44 years old and lives in a community called Osa, in Puntarenas province.  This community is in a rural area which attracts a lot of visitors because of its beaches.  The main business activities in this area are related to tourism, farming and livestock raising.  The local economy is based on farming and livestock raising.  Common crops are tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and cattle raising is common too.

Anaceli has been needing to make some repairs to her home for several months.  She has not carried out this work because her income will not stretch far enough.  However, she would like her family to have a decent and safe home.

Anaceli is requesting a loan for 550,000 colones to buy building supplies and to pay workmen to fix her home's windows and doors.

Anaceli is a member of the Golfo Dulce Ltd. community loan company.  This is one of 150 member organizations of EDESA.  This will be Anaceli's second loan.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given to access loans as it allows her to carry out her projects.

loans.use: to buy building supplies, doors and windows

loans.name: Marcela Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer de 59 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de bebidas su historia empezó a tener necesidades y comenzó a vender bebidas poco a poco esta q ahora vendo mas, su trabajo lo hace sola a veces mis hijos que me ayudan, si tiene dificultades son la inseguridad y las enfermedades, no está casada, si tiene 4 hijos son mayores de edad, su sueño más importante es tener una despensa grande. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de bebidas.
texts.en: Isabel is a 59 year old woman and she has many aspirations for the upcoming years of prospering in her beverage sales business.  Her story started when she was in need and she began to sell beverages little by little and now she sells more.  She works alone, but sometimes her children help her.  If she has difficulties, they are insecurity and illnesses.  She isn't married, but she has 4 adult children.  Her most important dream is to have a large store.  For this reason, she would like the loan for her beverage sales.

loans.use: to sell beverages.

loans.name: Goreeti

texts.en: Gorreti is a 42-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a tea farmer and has been for over 20 years, having started this with her husband's help. Challenges she faces include customers not paying on time, price fluctuations, and seasonal weather. Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent house, and hire employees to help expand her business. Gorreti needs this loan to harvest three acres of a tea plantation.

loans.use: to harvest three acres of a tea plantation

loans.name: Cherif

texts.fr: Chérif travaille dans un tribunal comme courtier. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Parallèlement  à son métier, Chérif  fait de l’aviculture chez lui. Activité qu’il a démarrée en 2010 avec presque rien. IL sollicite un crédit pour augmenter  la quantité des sujets. Il va pouvoir acheter 2 caisses de poussins, leurs aliments et les produits vétérinaires qui leur permettent d’arriver à terme en bonne santé et prêt pour la consommation. Chérif n’a aucunes charges qui l’encombrent et préfère épargner son argent pour être bien dans le futur.
texts.en:
Chérif is a court officer. He is single and doesn’t have any children. As a sideline, he started raising poultry at home in 2010 with practically no capital. 

He is seeking a loan to buy two crates of chicks, some chicken feed, and the veterinary products necessary to bring the chickens to term healthy and ready for consumption. 

Chérif doesn’t have other expenditures and prefers to save his money so he can live comfortably in future years.

loans.use: to buy two crates of chicks.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: La Sra. Eulogia es cliente antigua, que esta en su secuencia desina primera, durante el tiempo que trabajo con emprender, demostró responsabilidad y buena actitud de pago, la Sra. Eulogia vive en la zona Tacagua, cerca de una parada de minibuses,  ella expende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un acalle muy concurrida de la ciudad de la Paz, ella vende los días sábados y domingos, la Sra. Eulogia solicita el crédito que esta  destinado a la compra de azúcar y arroz por mayor, para aprovechar la baja de precios y después venderlos por meno, la Sra. Eulogia es un apersona muy  trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan  a crecer en su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eulogia is an old client who is in her eleventh loan cycle. She has demonstrated responsibility and a good attitude towards repayments during her time working with Emprender. Eulogia lives near a minibus stop in the Tacagua zone. She sells her products in a stand located on a very busy street in the city of La Paz. She sells on Saturdays and Sundays.
